data.whatItDoes:
​Beyond a payment gateway, Cybersource offers a full suite of componentized services, including fraud, tokenization and global omnichannel acceptance, to provide businesses with flexibility to use only those services they need. For Acquirers and partners, that means the ability to white label the platform. With a single connection to Cybersource, businesses can connect to their choice of Acquirers and processors enabling them to expand acceptance globally by adding channels and payment methods quickly and cost-effectively.

Payment acceptance. Expand to new markets by accepting payment in new geographies from over 190+ countries and territories across the world with 150+ acquirers and processors, across multiple channels and form factors through a single connection.

Fraud management. Cybersource’s fraud management solutions include insights from more than 68 billion annual Visa and Cybersource transactions processed worldwide. From monitoring to detection rules to managed risk services, reducing payment friction with data-driven insights, intelligent scoring and years of experience to capture more revenue and provide a seamless customer experience.

Payment security. Keep sensitive payment data off payment environments. Cybersource provides simple, secure ways to get up and running quickly to reduce exposure to risk and ensure PCI compliance in accepting payments while retaining full control of the user experience.  As a whole, Cybersource helps businesses operate with agility and reach their digital commerce goals by enhancing customer experience, growing revenues and mitigating risk.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Payments should never limit a client's growth or curb their vision. Together with Cybersource, businesses are able to create a payments experience that supports growth, fits their way of doing things, and lets their vision be as grand as it can be. Put simply, Cybersource helps sellers, Acquirers and partners to fulfill their commerce ambitions. It’s flexible (easier to do business anywhere in the world with a single integration), it’s creative (build their own features using our open architecture) and it’s secure (built on Visa-grade systems and designed by hands-on experts). 

Cybersource is a modular payment management platform with a robust suite of payment solutions that enables over 450,000 businesses to create modern payment experiences that spur growth and innovation, safely and securely. Built on Visa infrastructure, Cybersource is a proven platform with the scale and resilience underscored by Cybersource’s 2020 global processing volume of $599 billion, 21 billion transactions, fraud prevention of $12.6 billion and 3.4 billion tokens under management. 

Cybersource delivers these commerce solutions for everyday life through three central pillars: Global Reach, Modern Capabilities and Commerce Insights.

Global Reach. Seamless payments, global footprint with a single integration.

• Open, modular platform.

• Clients can sell, buy, pay and be paid their way.

• Wherever clients want to be, Cybersource with Visa gets their payments there.

Modern Capabilities. Commerce experiences as unique as clients' business and their customers require.

• Deliver frictionless experiences.

• Open technology that grows their way.

• Add value with every transaction.

Commerce Insights. Secure, proven Visa-grade systems actively informed by billions of transactions.

• Optimize a client's fraud strategy.

• Maximize acceptance.

• Protect a client's brand and data with every transaction.

• Payments powering a client's growth and vision, securely.

The full version of the Cybersource catalog is available here on compass: https://visaplaybook.force.com/Compass/s/contentversion/0694Q000009K9ORQA0/detail

data.whatItDoes:
The Cybersource Digital Payment Suite is built on the Cybersource payment management platform. It allows businesses to securely accept and process payments received from cards, digital wallets, Click to Pay and alternative payment methods.

Cybersource digital wallets can help extend your reach and improve conversion with minimal IT overhead. Quickly add a range of global and regional payment methods, enabling a fast and convenient payment experience for consumers whether they are purchasing via an app or mobile browser.
data.whatItDelivers:
​The Digital Payment Suite is a unified payment acceptance solution designed to simplify the adoption and integration of digital wallets and other digital payments for businesses. And with Cybersource, businesses can capitalize on the platform to enter markets faster by accessing digital wallets and other digital payments in addition to the 150+ existing global processors and Acquirers with a single connection. 

Easily add a range of global wallets, such as Apple Pay, Android Pay, Chase Pay and Samsung Pay, as well as regional wallets such as KCP and Alipay. Standardized implementation, a common set of APIs and a consistent process help reduce complexity and increase efficiency. 

Whether in-app, mobile browser or on the Web, the Digital Payment Suite allows businesses to reach their customer and increase customer engagement.

• Single interface for accepting digital payments.

• Simple front-end integration with emerging digital standards.

• Ready to go with pre-integrated alternative payments and mobile apps (iOS, Android).

• Optimized for seamless customer experiences based on seller and customer data experiences based on seller and customer.

data.whatItDoes:
Verifi’s Dispute Representment is an end-to-end dispute response service offered to sellers that are looking to maximize their dispute revenue recovery rates. Using API technology, Verifi leverages seller’s payment and transaction data and 15 years of proprietary logic and expertise to respond and challenge disputes that have been filed against sellers. 

Verifi’s Dispute Representment provides a single point of integration across multiple dispute sources to maximize dispute response wins, effectively recovering revenue for sellers otherwise lost to disputes. Verifi’s team of specialists provide total managed services for sellers, expertly managing all aspects of dispute response creation and delivery as well as in-depth reporting and analysis for seller clients.
data.whatItDelivers:
Outsourced managed service. Verifi specialists use their expertise to include best evidence and deliver an accurate, formatted response package.

Global dispute sources. Verifi collects and syncs dispute data directly from dispute sources like acquirers, processors, etc. 

Flexible integration. Simple integration options provided to seller to facilitate quick onboarding.

Enhanced reporting. Access on-demand reporting to improve financial forecasting and key performance indicators for maximum revenue protection.

Card brand agnostic. Supports disputes with Visa, Mastercard, Amex, Discover and PayPal.

data.whatItDoes: Order Insight, previously Visa Merchant Purchase Inquiry (VMPI), provides issuers and cardholders with detailed seller and transaction information via a global data-sharing network to prevent disputes at first cardholder inquiry​. Enhanced seller and transaction details are provided to cardholders to validate sales through online and mobile banking applications. Issuer call center and back-office customer service teams can access the data when handling customer dispute inquiries.
data.whatItDelivers:
Prevent disputes with data transparency. Make it easy for cardholders to review purchase details at inquiry, delivering improved visibility to combat friendly fraud, preventing unnecessary disputes and fraud claims.

Reduced operational drain. Avoid unnecessary customer service calls and reduce waiting time by directing cardholders to details within issuer online and mobile banking applications.

Remove unnecessary disputes. Reduced dispute volume and liability costs across the payments ecosystem by validating sales with cardholders.

Improve the post-purchase experience. Sellers can empower customers with simple, on-demand access to details to self-resolve purchase inquiries.

data.whatItDoes:
Rapid Dispute Resolution enables sellers to provide an automated resolution at the pre-dispute stage. Real-time resolution improves the customer experience, reduces operational drain and provides transparency. 

Delivered through VROL to issuers and Verifi systems to sellers, RDR provides sub-second resolution at the pre-dispute stage with a credit to the buyer’s account. RDR enables auto-decisioning of pre-dispute cases using a robust decision engine, customized by seller for near real-time resolution.
data.whatItDelivers:
• Expedited resolution supports issuer dispute automation.

• Avoid disputes and management with near real-time seller liability acceptance of dispute at issuer submission.

• Customer satisfaction through immediate resolution and return of funds.

data.description: Visa Resolve Online (VROL) is a global dispute processing platform that provides clients a faster and more efficient way to access and manage dispute processing.
data.whatItDoes: VROL enables issuers and acquirers to process disputes as part of their front-line and back-office workflow to help streamline the dispute process and improve the cardholder and seller experience. In April 2018, Visa modernized the dispute process. This new process utilized the existing Visa Resolve Online infrastructure to automate and streamline the entire dispute process end-to-end.
data.whatItDelivers: Visa Resolve Online provides financial institutions a full array of dispute management services in one platform, removing the need for multiple integrations to process a dispute. Visa Resolve Online manages disputes in a real-time format allowing clients more efficiencies to better serve their sellers and consumers. VROL also provides value added services that help clients manage their seller and consumer post purchase disputes. These include pre-dispute services (e.g., Rapid Dispute Resolution, Order Insight, Order Insight Digital), fraud reporting (Visa Risk-based Auto Dispute), exception file listing, adjustments and many others. The platform provides flexible interface options to meet client needs. VROL’s User Interface, is an out of the box solution that provides clients a full dispute processing solution and requires no coding changes. VROL’s Real-time System Interface (RTSI), is an API based solution that also provides a full dispute processing solution and can be integrated with a client’s host platform.

data.description: Visa Risk-based Auto-Dispute (VRAD) is an optional service that simplifies and automates the recovery process for eligible fraud transactions. This service is available to Visa Resolve Online (VROL) and Visa Risk Manager (VRM) clients and enables full automation of fraud dispute processing for eligible authorizations marked and reported as fraud in VRM.
data.whatItDoes: VRAD uses risk management tools to identify fraud up-front at the Authorization and enables fully-automated dispute processing.
data.whatItDelivers:
• Streamline Operations. Issuers will have more options through the Visa product portfolio.

• Improved Authorization Approval Rates. Clients nominate chargeback costs as the reason to decline valid and low value transactions. By using VAA and VRM, VRAD will help issuers make better authorization decisions.

• Enhanced Service Cardholder experience improves with faster dispute resolution outcome.

• Reduce Costs. VRAD increases processing efficiencies, reduces the need for issuer infrastructure and can improve the Issuer’s bottom line by automating the process. VRAD processing costs vary by region, please refer to the Visa Risk Auto Dispute VBN published August, 2019.

• Improved Dispute Fraud Data Quality. VRAD reduces the risk of data entry errors.

• Decreased Complexity. VRAD streamlines the fraud dispute process with an automated workflow for approved disputes that combines dispute initiation (or write off), fraud reporting and exception file updates.

data.whatItDoes:
​The global prevalence and growth of mass transit provides an excellent opportunity to expand chip payments into mass transit systems, an area typically dominated by cash. Visa is working with clients to implement contactless payment technology for fast, convenient and secure fare collection. 

Contactless payments for mass transit can increase business opportunities for the following clients:

• Government and transit authorities. City/government managers, transit authorities (PTAs/PTOs). 

• Private transit entities. 

• Private transit companies. 

• Tech enablers. Financial institutions and payment service providers acquiring transactions for transit merchants. Contactless payments offer a new market segment that provides opportunity to displace cash. 

• Financial institutions. Issuing contactless-enabled cards (this includes mobile and other device form factors). Contactless payments help drive top of wallet customer preference, along with opportunity for further innovation.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Visa has developed the below flexible transit models that enable the acceptance of “open-loop” payment cards based on contactless chip technology for fast, convenient and secure fare collection within transit environments of variable complexity:

• Mass Transit Transaction (MTT). Versatile contactless-only solution for complex or multimodal mass transport environments. The Visa contactless card is used at points of access to the transit service on readers that accept contactless payments only. The final fare amount is not always known at the time of travel but is calculated at the end of a travel period by the mass transit merchant based on journeys made during that time.

• Known Fare Transaction (KFT). Simple contactless-only solution for environments with high passenger throughput. The Visa contactless card is used at points of access to the transit service where the fare charge is known by the reader, which accepts contactless payments only. 

Visa can also help transit agencies coordinate and facilitate innovation spanning public and private entities that delivers improved UM experiences, with greater efficiency and lower costs, creating more livable cities without disruption to existing transit systems. These agencies:

• Need secure, turnkey solutions that can be easily integrated with existing infrastructure and are easily adopted. 

• Seek cost-effective solutions that can be easily integrated, deployed and scaled to improve customer experiences and help create competitive differentiation. 

• Seek standard, global platforms to secure mass adoption of newly developed, innovative technologies so they may build once and scale to many. 

• Desire access to capabilities that expedite deployment of technologies and make them more secure and less expensive to adopt.

data.familyDescription: Visa is committed to helping the urban mobility industry and cities around the world improve the urban transit experience and transit operators and contribute to more livable cities by offering fast, secure payment experiences that work seamlessly across public and private modes of transportation.

data.notes: Changed the name from Tap to Pay back to contactless per a note from Andrea Linsky. Note - this does NOT map with the May 2021 taxonomy from playbook.
data.whatItDoes:
Tap to pay benefits the entire ecosystem—consumers, merchants and issuers. Tap to pay provides consumers with a seamless, fast and secure experience at the point of sale, merchants with faster throughput and improved operational efficiency and issuers with a key differentiator and a cash displacement opportunity. Tap to pay leverages near-field communication technology (NFC) and provides consumers with the same secure EMV architecture as contact chips. Additionally, tapping to pay is the underlying infrastructure supporting emerging payment innovations including wearables and mobile devices in addition to the transit space and contactless-only environments.

Tap to pay has significant global momentum. As of August 2021, 48.1% of all transactions globally were done with a tap and exclude the U.S., that number becomes 69%.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Seamless consumer experience

Before COVID-19, ~73% of transactions occurred face-to-face, meaning that consumers’ primary payment experiences happen in person. Additionally, our research clearly demonstrates that consumers prefer to use cards vs. other forms of payment. While EMV introduced greater security, it slowed the face-to-face experience. As a result, tap to pay was introduced in markets around the world and has provided consumers with a fast, secure experience.

Cash displacement

Cash remains the largest opportunity for electronic payment growth around the world. For the U.S., according to a Euromonitor study, cash accounted for $2T in payment volume in 2016, roughly 20% of purchase PCE. Additionally, as recent as 2020, the federal reserve reported that 47% of all transactions below $10 were cash. The widespread issuance and acceptance of contactless cards has correlated strongly with cash displacement in a number of global markets. For contactless active cards there is an incremental 2.5 transactions and $71 of spend per month for debit card tappers and an incremental 1.6 transactions and $56 of spend per month for credit card tappers.

Operational efficiency

Merchants who enable tap to pay have seen an increase in operational efficiency due to faster transaction times, reduction in cash handling, reduction in employee theft and an increase in sales due to being able to checkout more consumers due to reduced lines.

Transit

As more and more transit agencies around the world evaluate moving from closed-loop systems to open-loop payment systems, issuers putting transit-ready contactless cards in consumers hands is key due to these environments being contactless-only. In the last three years, more than 250 transit systems globally have adopted contactless ticketing systems and for merchants in the surrounding area, there is a halo effect of a 15% lift in transactions once transit is enabled.

Competitive differentiation

Contactless cards are becoming table stakes for large and innovative issuers, and contactless technology is foundational for emerging use cases, such as tap to phone or contactless-only acceptance. Issuing contactless cards and offering contactless at the POS gives issuers and merchants the opportunity to demonstrate payments leadership and innovation. Contactless cards can help issuers maintain brand visibility with their cardholders, while allowing them to pay in a fast, seamless and innovative way at enabled merchants. In light of COVID-19, 57% of consumers are now tapping a contactless card on a terminal more often.

data.whatItDoes: The Global Gateway allows businesses to scale quickly and safely through one connection to markets worldwide. It provides seamless payments and a global footprint that makes it easier to do business anywhere in the world with a single integration.
data.whatItDelivers: The Global Gateway connects to 150+ acquirers and processors in 190+ countries and territories, with funding options in 50+ currencies through a single connection. It supports credit and debit card processing for Visa-branded cards, Mastercard, American Express, Discover, JCB, Diners Club and UnionPay along with a range of regional and local cards, such as Maestro, Cartes Bancaires, RuPay, Aura and Hipercard. There is also support for private label cards, Level II purchasing cards and pre-paid/gift cards that are Visa/Mastercard/American Express branded. The Global Gateway also supports major global alternative payment methods. In addition, the gateway offers rule configuration that allows businesses to specify routing based on card brand, currency, amount and other parameters for supported processors, enabling dynamic routing at the time of transaction.

data.whatItDoes:
Visa Platform Connect (VPC) is Cybersource’s direct connection to VisaNet and enables streamlined global Acquirer and processor connectivity. 

Visa Platform Connect is a single, rapid connection for acquirers to Cybersource’s payment management services through VisaNet. It is a connectivity model that extends Cybersource payment management services to acquiring financial institutions and their sellers. The processing platform routes credit card authorizations directly to VisaNet and payment capture files to Acquirers. Visa Platform Connect provides a fast and efficient method of payment processing, mandate compliance and global expansion, requiring comparatively low investment and maintenance.  

With 120+ connections accessing 180+ Visa Acquirers, VPC optimizes global reach for gateway processing and access to local settlement capabilities. Additionally, by leveraging VisaNet’s Authorization Gateway Services, it enables scheme processing for multiple non-Visa brands including Mastercard, American Express, Discover, Diners Club and JCB where supported.
data.whatItDelivers:
​A proven, reliable network solution that showcases the enhancements and improvements that come from extensive experience, with resilient security built in. It is a powerful foundation for a scalable, tailored payments solution designed for unique situations.

• A cost effective and efficient method of global expansion.

• An efficient delivery channel of additional Visa products and services, including tech partner integrations, available through VisaNet.

• A way to maintain compliance online for Acquirers based on the data hosting and security capabilities of VisaNet.

data.description:
Visa BIN Attribute Sharing Service (VBASS) is an optional service that enables sharing of Visa BIN data (e.g., Issuer Name, Country, Product Information and more) with sellers and third parties. The service offers two delivery options:

Direct access. Connecting directly to VBASS APIs on the Visa Developer Platform.

• VBASS APIs on the Visa Developer Platform enables issuers, acquirers and merchants/other third parties (sponsored by acquirers) with direct access to Visa BIN data.

• VBASS includes two APIs that provide different ways of accessing the Visa BIN Attributes—the Full BIN List API and the Single BIN Lookup API.

• The Full BIN List API allows clients to request a full file list of issuer BIN Attributes such as Product Information, Issuer Name, Issuer Country and more.

• The Single BIN Lookup API allows clients to request issuer BIN attribute data on an account-by-account basis. This API provides attributes (e.g., Product ID) at the account level, which in certain cases may differ from the attributes set at the BIN level as it may include the Account Level Management updates, as provided by issuers.

Indirect access. Receiving the BIN attributes from an acquirer or an acquirer sponsored processor or third party.

Why VBASS? As the payment’s industry continues to evolve, particularly in e-commerce, sellers are continuously searching for ways to operate more profitably (e.g., increase approval rates, reduce fraud) and differentiate their point-of-sale experience (e.g., online checkout customization). Visa BIN Attributes can help enhance a wide variety of seller needs. By obtaining BIN Attributes directly from Visa, sellers can ensure they are getting the most up-to-date information to improve their processes.

data.whatItDoes:
Token Management Service is an omnichannel solution that replaces sensitive payment data with a unique identifier, or secure token, across payment types and processing environments. 

Token Management Service brings a double benefit. It enables businesses to create new and different digital experiences, such as buy-online-pickup-in-store (BOPIS), to expand revenue options. At the same time, it provides deeper insights into customer behaviors. Our service is powered by Visa-grade systems with security built in.   

The actual payment data is securely stored in Cybersource data centers, which are operated by Visa, Inc. The service supports tokenizing payment cards, eCheck and payment scheme network tokens. It offers a card-on-file Network Token Requestor for Visa Token Services (VTS) and Mastercard Tokens (M4M) with continual support for the other EMVCo Network token types. Additionally, Cybersource supports and passes the EMVCo Payment Account Reference (PAR) numbers. Token Management Service masks the customer’s payment instrument for secure digital transactions and more importantly, generating a "customer token" which links channels, partner/network tokens and payment accounts to create a single, 360-degree profile of the customer and their purchase behavior. 

As a componentized service, it is available fully integrated with payment management or as a standalone service.
data.whatItDelivers:
Token Management Service removes the complexity of token management by standardizing tokens across providers, channels and payment types. Through a single connection, it streamlines the handling of multiple methods and token types, from network, acquirer, and non-card. The service can handle tokenizing payment cards, eChecks and payment scheme network tokens. It offers a card-on-file Network Token Requestor for Visa Token Services and Mastercard Tokens with continual support for the other EMVCo Network tokens types. Additionally, Cybersource supports and passes the EMVCo Payment Account Reference numbers. 

The service is uniquely positioned to provide both optionality and coverage of network, Acquirer and non-card token types from a singular platform. Built on Visa-grade systems, security is built-in while empowering clients to create new experiences.

• Token-of-tokens. Through a single connection, streamlines the handling of multiple methods and token types, from network, Acquirer and non-card.

• Safeguards business. Replaces sensitive card data in payment environments and customers’ actual payment information is stored in secure Visa data centers.

• Capture revenue. Improves conversion, payment optimization, revenue capture and compliance with the network tokens services and account updater.

• Customer engagement. Provides an easy way to create uniquely different digital experiences (e.g. buy online, pickup in-store, order ahead, card-on-file) to expand client revenue opportunities.

• Billions of tokens under management. There are more than 3.4 billion Cybersource tokens in use throughout the world.

data.whatItDoes:
Visa Account Updater (VAU) helps sellers avoid disruption in customer relationships and recurring/COF payments when account information changes, thereby increasing authorization rates.  

Keeping payment information up to date is complex, costly and time-consuming for merchants. Visa Account Updater (VAU) offers two solutions that solve this problem: VAU and Real Time VAU.

• With VAU, enrolled merchants submit inquiries regarding accounts with which they have ongoing relationships. VAU responds and provides updates.

• Real Time Visa Account Updater integrates VAU into the VisaNet authorization process, enabling real time updates.

• Each solution has unique capabilities, but both provide automatic account updates to merchants and acquirers and can help maintain a positive payment experience for merchants and customers.   

Visa Account Updater enables a secure electronic exchange of account information updates between participating Visa card issuers and acquirers for credential-on-file merchants, which enables a more seamless payment process. When participating issuers re-issue cards, they submit the new account number and expiration date to Visa Account Updater. Participating merchants send inquiries on their credentials-on-file to Visa Account Updater and are provided with updated card information, if available. This helps participating issuers retain cardholders by maintaining continuity of their payment relationships with participating merchants.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Visa Account Updater helps issuers ensure a positive payment experience for their cardholders and maintain their top of wallet status. VAU helps avoid disruption in customer relationships with COF and recurring billing merchants due to card credentials changes—reducing the need for cardholders to contact merchants themselves to update their credentials. 

Merchant benefits:
• Increases authorization approvals.
• Reduces the opportunity for service cancellation.
• Simplifies and secures credential on file transactions.
• Strengthens customer relationships and retention, while helping increase sales.
• Reduces the costs associated with contacting cardholders to obtain updated information.
• Cuts customer service expenses by preventing interruption of payment relationship.

Cardholder benefits:
• Offers a seamless account-update process, eliminating the need for direct action on the part of the cardholder.
• Facilitates uninterrupted service for participating merchants.
• Reduces negative experiences caused by declines.

data.familyDescription: Visa Account Updater (VAU) enables the secure exchange of updated account information between issuers and acquirers for recurring billing and credential on file sellers enabling a more seamless payment process.

data.whatItDoes:
Issuer Key Risk Indicators (IRKI) reports provide participating Issuers with a monthly, end-to-end view of key risk indicators to help them improve risk performance. These indicators provide a full portfolio view of over 60 consumer card portfolio metrics including card usage, fraud, credit quality, bankruptcy, recoveries, authorization performance, loss performance and disputes & chargebacks. IRKI reports can be accessed via Visa Analytics Platform.   

Card portfolio metrics available through IRKI include:

• Card usage data and risk indicators. Outstandings and sales volume growth rates, active accounts, percent of accounts revolving and average credit line and line utilization. 

• Bankruptcy data and risk indicators. Gross bankruptcies and net bankruptcies.

• Fraud data and risk indicators. Initial fraud vs. net sales volume, net fraud chargeoffs vs. net sales volume and fraud recovery rate.

• Credit quality data and risk indicators. Credit chargeoff, good-to-bad ratios, average credit risk score, and average delinquent account balance.

• Recovery data and risk indicators. Recover rates and average contractual recovery amount.
data.whatItDelivers:
Issuer Key Risk Indicators reports provide the following benefits:   

• Easy to use. Get access to all key metrics via a single IRKI report instead of pulling them from multiple sources.   

• Powerful benchmarking. Peer benchmarks that include metrics from IRKI participants.   

• Strong participation. Portfolio performance KPI results delivered from 20+ card issuers across payment networks.

• Comprehensive portfolio metrics. Full portfolio view of card portfolio metrics.

data.whatItDoes:
Visa Analytics Platform is a web-based, self-service analytics solution that puts payments data and insights at your fingertips. Our powerful peer benchmarking¹, easy-to-understand dashboards and customizable reports empower users across your organization to gain actionable payments intelligence — helping you make faster, more informed business decisions. Visa Analytics Platform provides: 

Fast access to payments insights. Visa Analytics Platform provides detailed payments data to help meet your needs — allowing you to get granular, faster, and get actionable insights with less effort. 

Powerful peer benchmarking. Visa Analytics Platform provides powerful business intelligence through detailed, anonymized peer benchmarks¹ — empowering you to quickly find opportunities to help improve performance and become top-of-wallet. 

Easy to use tools. Easy-to-understand dashboards with pre-built visualizations make key insights accessible to users — even for non-analytics experts. This helps you to make data-driven decisions more quickly, while reducing operational burden on your analytics department.
data.whatItDelivers:
With Visa Analytics Platform, you can empower a variety of users across your organization with insights to help accelerate decision-making:

Data Analysts. Access customizable reports with rich payments data to dive deeper and help answer detailed follow-up questions with less effort. 

Managers. Deliver actionable insights and reports with intuitive workflows and pre-built visualizations — empowering teams to make data-driven decisions. 

Executives. Assess business performance at a glance. New dashboards make it easy to gain key portfolio and peer insights — helping identify potential growth opportunities faster and guide businesses with more confidence.

1. All benchmarks are based on competitive peer sets.

data.whatItDoes: Visa Click to Pay is an easy, smart and secure online payment experience that minimizes manual card-entry friction, which can help lower cart abandonment and increase transaction conversions.  Visa Click to Pay has a strong user foundation with 50M+ consumer accounts around the world already set up in Visa Click to Pay today.  Visa Click to Pay users will recognize the familiar experience, with their cards and credentials ready-to-use, in 15K+ participating merchants across 25 markets around the world with plans to continue expanding further in key global markets.  Visa Click to Pay availability is dependent on critical external factors, including cross network interoperability.
data.whatItDelivers: A consistent payment experience framework through a common payment mark (EMV’s Click to Pay icon ‍‍ similar to the contactless acceptance indicator) and common experience for participating networks—Visa, Mastercard and Amex available today with Discover and China Union Pay in the pipeline.  The Click to Pay icon lets consumers know that they are checking out with a secure, convenient and standardized experience.  With Visa Click to Pay, clients will access a standardized payment payload for processing and integration across the participating networks. Integrated cardholder security through the use of cardholder verification, issuer authentication and interoperability with tokens and 3-D Secure 2.0, the consumer authentication framework for digital commerce.

data.whatItDoes:
Visa Token Service (VTS) is a platform that secures payments to help better position all players in the payment ecosystem for new digital experiences. 

Tokens are able to protect payments by replacing sensitive account numbers with unique digital identifiers. Visa Token Service also unlocks benefits beyond the 16-digit account number - enabling new services, richer data and better experiences that can lead to higher revenue and lower costs. 

With tokens, partners can: 

• Increase security by replacing PAN storage, reduce data breaches, mitigate fraud and transfer and enhance cardholder authentication. 

• Improve CNP authorization rates and drive higher merchant sales. Tokens can provide additional cardholder authentication information during transactions and maintain up-to-date credentials.

Tokens can benefit all players in the payment ecosystem.

Key VTS features include:

• Unique Cryptograms. Help tokens defend against replay attacks and other forms of fraud by generating new cryptograms with each transaction. 

• Cloud Token Framework. Builds on the VTS capabilities of E-Com and Card-On-File (COF) token types and includes new capabilities to better serve the evolving opportunities in digital commerce. These new capabilities include:

• Device Binding. Ties a new or existing token to a trusted device and allows device data to be shared in token transactions.

• Consumer Authentication. Allows issuers to perform consumer authentication at the time of device binding and can further validate the cardholder during subsequent transactions with the help of device data and CDCVM (Consumer Device Cardholder Verification Method). 

• Lifecycle Management. Updates account information automatically when a card is stolen, expired, or replaced so customers don’t have to manually enter their card details. 

• Domain Controls. Reduces both the risk and impact of fraud by allowing users to limit token usage to specific channels, merchants, spending limits and dates. 

• Secure Remote Commerce (SRC). Provides protection in every step of the payment flow.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Token adoption benefits all players in the payment ecosystem. Visa has enabled 165 markets for tokenization covering 90 percent of Visa’s total payment volume with more than 8200 issuers enabled, 13000+ merchants transacting with Visa Tokens and over 1.1B tokenized transactions in total. 

Partners realize a 3.2% average increase in authorization rates and a 26% average reduction in fraud by payment volume. These improvements, which result in better security, revenue and customer experience, ensure partners can offer modern digital payment options.  

Use cases include:

• eCommerce solutions. One of the biggest trends in online shopping is "card-on-file," which allows users to save their card details with a merchant or mobile wallet for future purchases. With tokens, accounts can be stored securely and card data can be updated automatically for a better checkout experience. 

• New use cases. Token technology is expanding beyond payments. New token use cases include digital ticketing, loyalty, bank accounts and coupons.

data.whatItDoes: dCVV2 is a simple, low-impact way to introduce dynamic data into card-not-present transactions. Because it’s dynamic data, it’s far less vulnerable to fraudulent re-use if compromised and can therefore help to control card-not-present fraud. It’s a three-digit code that replaces the existing static CVV2 code in authorization messages. It can be made available to a consumer either via a small screen on the back of their card or via a mobile app or SMS. Once obtained, the consumer enters it into a merchant’s website or provides it verbally over the phone, exactly as they would a static CVV2.  Visa has three services that enable issuers to adopt dCVV2 quickly and with minimal changes to their host systems.
data.whatItDelivers:
• dCVV2 Generate. An API that allows issuers or third parties to call into Visa and obtain dCVV2 codes to be provided to consumers. Fast and cost-efficient adoption of dCVV2 for issuers, to assist with card-not-present fraud control.

• dCVV2 Authenticate. A service that validates dCVV2 codes on behalf of issuers, in real-time, during authorization.  Issuers can choose to receive the result of the check, for use in their authorization decision or Visa can decline all transactions where the validation failed. Reduced issuer host development required to support dCVV2, enabling faster and more cost-efficient adoption.

• dCVV2 Convert. A service that replaces the dCVV2 code in an authorization message with a static CVV2 value. Minimizes issuer host development required to support dCVV2, enabling faster and more cost-efficient adoption.

data.whatItDoes: Visa is an industry leader in the implementation of EMV technology, which secures card present transactions through dynamic authentication. In August 2011, Visa was the first major network to propose a roadmap accelerating the migration to EMV technology in the U.S.. Implementation of EMV technology is important because it greatly reduces the ability to carry out counterfeit fraud, improves overall network security and improves international interoperability.  Visa knows that EMV is a critical component of a secure and efficient payments system and is thoroughly invested in ensuring that all members of the payments ecosystem have the support they need to make a smooth transition.
data.whatItDelivers:
• Future innovation. The adoption of contact and contactless chip technology is critically important to all key stakeholders in the payment industry. It not only supports the increasing demand for enhanced global acceptance and security through the use of dynamic authentication, it also helps prepare the payment infrastructure for near field communication (NFC) based mobile payments. As such, Visa has created a framework that will facilitate growth opportunities for issuers, acquirers and merchants alike.

• Fight counterfeit fraud. EMV cards have an embedded microchip that securely stores and generates the information required to authenticate, authorize and process transactions.

• Global standard. When cardholders travel internationally, their purchase experiences are simplified with Visa chip cards. Visa chip cards will also continue to carry a magnetic stripe, which means that Visa cardholders may use their Visa chip cards at merchants that have not yet upgraded to chip technology.

EMV Chip Tools include:

VPA - Visa Personalization Assistant is an application hosted on VOL. The product facilitates the creation of EMV Personalization profiles for issuers or their processors by posing high level business questions to the user and creating a corresponding profile that can then be provided to the Perso Bureau. The tool enforces Visa-specific requirements, both on a regional and global level and also provides guidance on Visa best practices.​

Level 3 (L3) Chip Acceptance Testing - L3 testing helps ensure that chip terminals that have been configured for deployment by acquirers are correctly integrated into the Visa payment acceptance environment and do not unduly contribute to interoperability problems. This improves acceptance of Visa-branded products.

data.whatItDelivers: The primary benefit of the adoption of Chip technology is counterfeit fraud reduction.  This is achieved by the Chip application on the card or in the mobile device creating a unique cryptogram for each transaction.  Chip Authenticate validates these cryptograms on behalf of issuers, avoiding the need for issuers to invest in this capability at their own cost.  Chip Authenticate is automatically updated to support new cryptogram versions that are introduced from time to time, and to protect against new fraud vectors, providing ongoing value to issuers.

data.whatItDoes: Account Level Management (ALM) provides issuers, fintechs, processors and rewards providers a suite of services to efficiently manage spend-based cardholder programs that offer flexible benefits, help drive focused marketing campaigns and optimize digital issuance. These services include program segmentation, Account Level Processing (ALP), spend-based product qualification, account linking and reporting. ALM services can be enabled individually or used together to provide the best solutions based on the needs of the client.
data.whatItDelivers:
• Flexibility. The Registered Program Manager (RPM) application enables program segmentation and provides the flexibility to manage multiple cardholder programs to help optimize portfolios. Each program can be targeted towards a cardholder segment with a unique set of rules, benefits and rewards to maximize card usage. Clients send cardholder data through an ALM integration channel for enhanced interchange and program segmentation.

• Continuity & convenience. Account Level Processing (ALP) supports Issuers and fintechs to deliver convenience and provide cardholders with the delightful consumer experiences that they've come to expect from Visa. ALP allows cardholders to retain the same account number as their rewards program, benefits or loyalty programs change over time. By doing so, it enables seamless continuity for both the issuer and cardholder and reduces the risk of cardholder attrition.

• Accuracy & financial control. Spend-based product qualification requirements are used to assess each account’s interchange eligibility and can automatically upgrade or downgrade the interchange product for each account based on its spend qualification. Spend-based qualification requirements are also used to determine rebate eligibility associated with product card fees.

• Customer tracking. Account linking services are used to aggregate spend for interchange qualification, supports replacement of lost/stolen cards to maintain a cardholder’s spend history and enables linking cards together that belong to a single household or business which can be used to identify the primary cardholder and authorized users.

• Reporting & analysis. Reports leverage Visa’s expertise and transforms the data into insights that help clients optimize their portfolios, improve efficiency and analyze trends. Issuers and fintechs gain visibility into the impact of their spend assessment, as well as, understanding the profitability of their portfolios. Custom reporting is available to provide additional portfolio analysis.

data.description:
​Effective and holistic management of transactions and user experiences across payment networks presents material complexity for issuers and processors.  Message content, format and rules vary and each network has different capabilities and tools.  For example, VisaNet has a broad array of capabilities to enrich transactions, further protect against fraud and enhance the user experience, but these assets can only be applied to activity traversing VisaNet.

Enhanced Visa Services (EVS) fills the blind spot between Visa transactions routed on VisaNet and those routed off-VisaNet, by expanding select Visa Value Added Services to operate outside of VisaNet: for example, domestic networks, regional networks and RTP. This brings consistency of Visa products and value-added services for Issuers, processors and cardholders, regardless of routing options. EVS further helps issuers/processors to consolidate services across networks, creating simplicity, efficiencies and speed to market.

data.productExecutive_displayName: Zhang , Bingjie  (bingzhan) - Director, Global Product Commercialization Operations
data.description: Enables a single point of access to more than 20 global, national and regional POS and ATM networks, giving its clients a consistent experience. data.description:
Visa Global Customer Assistance Services (GCAS) provides issuers, through its global access and distribution network, the opportunity to extend customer support capacity and deliver superior emergency services like lost/stolen card reporting, emergency cash disbursement and emergency card replacement 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. Visa Global Customer Assistance Services include:

• Lost or Stolen Card Reporting (LSC). Cardholder initiates a call to report lost or stolen card. Visa GCAS associates will assist cardholders by blocking lost or stolen Visa card numbers on VisaNet and contacting the issuer. The entire process completes within 30 minutes. If the full card number is not available from the cardholder, GCAS can also use the card BIN to identify and send a report to the issuer so that they can identify the card number and proceed to block it themselves.

• Emergency Card Replacement (ECR) and Emergency Cash Disbursement (ECD). Cardholder initiates an ECR/ECD request to Visa. Visa GCAS associate notifies the Issuer via email/fax. Issuer approves the request and provides instructions via VES or email or fax to GCAS.  Once cardholder receives the card/cash, GCAS associate notifies issuer of request completion. The issuer can also initiate, update and track emergency service requests to Visa via phone, email, fax or VES application on VOL. GCAS has strategically located fulfillment centers and a robust card-embossing network in virtually five continents. This allows for worldwide cardholder support and expedited delivery of emergency services, e.g. cash disbursement within 2 hours and card replacement within 24-72 hours of approval by the issuer.

• Cardholder Inquiry Service (CIS). Cardholder reaches out to Visa by phone, email, chat with account-related questions or card benefits inquiries. Depending on the query, GCAS addresses it directly and through benefits service providers or connects the cardholder to issuer for assistance with account inquiries.

• Exception File Update (EFU). Issuer initiates a EFU request via email or fax to GCAS. Visa GCAS will initiate an update message to the Visa Exception File on an issuer’s behalf within 30 minutes. GCAS can notify the issuer once the request is complete. EFU prevents declines based on transaction amount for VIP clients and can be used to assign restrictions to cards based on region and card status.

data.whatItDoes: Visa In-App Provisioning enables issuers to immediately activate spend on new or reissued cards by pushing it to the customer's device-based issuer's app to mobile wallet without the need for a physical card. By doing so, issuers are cutting the time a customer must wait to use a card from days to seconds and providing an instantly gratifying and elevated digital experience.
data.whatItDelivers:
Visa In-App Provisioning delivers a seamless digital experience to cardholders. Cardholders simply press a button in their mobile banking app and within seconds their card is ready to use in either Apple Pay, Google Pay or Samsung Pay. For issuers, it reduces development complexity, infrastructure development and hardware cost traditionally required to implement in-app provisioning, thus providing a simplified implementation and a faster time to market. 

Benefits of implementing with Visa In-App Provisioning include: 

• Streamlined integration, one integration with Visa enables Apple Pay, Google Pay and Samsung Pay. 

• Eliminates encryption hardware complexity and costs. 

• Simplifies software development and reduces solution development costs. 

• Faster speed to market. 

• Reduces PCI and Pay wallet compliance requirements. 

• Network agnostic - Support encrypted payload creation for Visa and Mastercard cards.

data.whatItDoes: Visa Purchase Alerts is the easiest, lowest cost option for U.S. banks to give their cardholders access to transaction alerts and controls. This turnkey service (hosted by Visa) allows cardholders to receive near real-time notifications of transactions that are conducted on their enrolled Visa card accounts. We also offer a Premium version of the service that enables additional card controls. Cardholders to place restrictions on their cards defining when, where and how those cards can be used. With Visa Purchase Alerts Premium, cardholders can restrict international transactions and/or restrict card not present (e-commerce) transactions or temporarily disable card usage where no transactions can be authorized (card "off"). This near real-time insight provides customers with the ability to block unwanted transactions, be alerted to potential fraud and monitor their own spending based upon their preset preferences.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Visa Purchase Alerts provide Issuers with the following potential Issuer benefits:

• A near real-time tool to enable customers to report fraud earlier and set specific transaction blocks, which can help reduce Issuers’ costs of fraud.

• May enhance customers’ loyalty and confidence in their issuing financial institution as a result.

• Allows Issuers to comply with the Visa’s Transaction Alerts requirement as set forth in the Visa Rules.

• A true turnkey solution requiring no development by the Issuer with only days to enable. 

Visa Purchase Alerts Premium is a true turn-key solution that enables U.S. and LAC issuers to offer their consumer cardholders the ability to set card controls (only available in U.S. under Premium service) on how their enrolled cards are used and provides a robust set of near real-time transaction alerts.  The Premium service does not require any implementation by the issuer and is a Visa direct to cardholder service.  

The standard and Premium service include the following transaction alerts:

• Threshold Alert. 

• International Alert. 

• Card Not Present Alert. 

• Decline Alert. 

• Credit Alert. 

The Premium service include the following card controls:  

• Turn an enrolled card on or off. 

• Block international transactions (for any transaction amount). 

• Block Card Not Present transactions (for any transaction amount).

*Available only in United States and LAC

data.description: Visa Card Eligibility Service (VCES) enables merchants, partners, issuers, and acquirers to check eligibility of offers, promotions, and / or benefits based on a card number (PAN), subject to terms and restrictions, in real time.
data.whatItDoes: Visa Card Eligibility Service (VCES) enables merchants, partners, issuers, and acquirers to check eligibility of offers, promotions, and / or benefits based on a card number (PAN), subject to terms and restrictions, in real time.
data.whatItDelivers:
VCES is a card number verification product designed to promote targeted distribution of Visa card benefits. The service enables Visa issuers, merchants, partners, and acquirers to use a 16-digit card account number to check eligibility and benefit access rights available for the associated Visa cardholder.

Examples of the card benefits may include access to airport lounges, invitation only events, high-end cardholder care services (such as Visa Concierge), or access to sweepstakes registration. VCES stores program access rules for each program and provides the capability to check if a particular account number has access rights to a particular program.

• APIs deliver critical benefit information for product portals and customer servicing centers.

• Access to a wide range of niche benefits from merchants without a complex integration.

• A market-ready, cardholder-facing, white-label website created and hosted by Visa that can help increase cardholder awareness of benefits.

• Offer enhanced value to cardholders with micro-segmented benefit packages to help drive top-of-wallet status.

• Encourage engagement over time by enabling customer choice benefits with frictionless digital delivery.

data.description:
Engage customers in loyalty and offer programs with real-time experiences. The Visa Offers Platform (VOP) provides clients access to qualified Visa transaction data of enrolled cardholders. By integrating with VOP, clients can enhance their own loyalty and offer programs with real-time earn experiences and pay with points experiences. VOP accesses the VisaNet authorization and settlement streams to identify qualifying enrolled cardholder transactions and send relevant notifications to clients in real time. Approved for use in 80+ countries and it is live in every region.

Purchase verification. Verifies transactions in real-time or on settlement. Clients can trigger messaging to cardholders when a transaction meets certain criteria. Offers can be limited to specific geographic locations, store types, purchase method (online vs. in-store), spend thresholds, specific merchants, etc.

data.description:
The Visa Rewards Platform is a turnkey solution that provides banks with the tools, systems and content to run their own proprietary earn and burn rewards programs.

The platform features:

• A bank-branded digital first customer experience, offering a mobile responsive website, with integrated SMS and email communication channels.

• Points engine with flexible accrual and expiry rules.

• Travel and non-travel redemption catalog.

• Back-end admin panel for bank staff users.

• Campaign engine to run registration, activation and usage campaigns.

• Card-linked offers.

The Platform is integrated with Visa’s transaction data service (VLPS and Visa Offers Platform APIs) and Cybersource APIs to provide a hands-free implementation that does not require any technical integration from a bank for a Visa card only loyalty program.  For banks able to support a technical integration, the platform enables single sign-on from the bank’s website or mobile banking application and can support bank-wide loyalty programs, including non-Visa scheme cards.  The platform enables Real-Time Rewards Redemption, allowing customers to redeem their points against a recent purchase made with their Visa card. Integration with Visa’s Data Product scores provides a seamless way to run targeted spend campaigns through the platform.

data.description: The Account Name Inquiry (ANI) service allows card-not-present merchants and cash payout originators to validate that the name of the customer matches the name associated with a payment credential in the issuer's system prior to initiating a financial transaction.
data.whatItDoes: To perform ANI, the merchant collects the cardholder’s [full] legal name and sends it in a zero-amount Account Verification message*.  In response to the ANI request, the merchant receives an ANI result code that indicates whether the cardholder name matched, partially matched or did not match the cardholder’s legal name associated with payment account in the issuer systems.
data.whatItDelivers: Visa’s Account Name Inquiry service is intended to help address growth in Account Takeover fraud and Authorized Push Payment scams, market demand and increasing scrutiny from governments and regulators by offering a solution to enable verification of payee name via VisaNet.

data.description: The Visa Smart Debit/Credit Certificate Authority (VSDC CA) is responsible for the management of the Visa CA key pairs and for the certification of VSDC Issuer Public Keys (IPKs), essential for the support of transactions requiring offline data authentication (ODA). ODA functionality enables the offline identification of cards and devices, integral to open-loop urban mobility tap to pay transactions. Issuers submit requests, which includes an input file created according to EMVCo and Visa specifications, through the web-based user interface hosted on VOL. The application automatically validates the request and routes the request to the Visa certificates support team for final approval. Upon certification of an issuer IPK and approval of a certificate request, the VSDC CA application creates the certificate and makes it available for the issuer to download.

data.description: The Consumer Bill Payment Service (CBPS) is an optional service for third party consumer bill payment providers. It’s targeted toward merchant segments where cards are not commonly accepted (e.g., rent, education, utilities and government payments) and where the third parties do not have acceptance agreements with each biller, operating similarly to a Payment Facilitator. CBPS improves the bill payment experience by allowing cardholders to make card payments for bills, where they would normally have to pay via cash or ACH. The major advantages are it allows the third party bill pay provider to use the MCC of the underlying biller on whose behalf they are accepting payment transactions and allows the third party to accept transactions for entities the third party does not have a direct acceptance agreement with, allowing them to scale to many billers.

data.description: Token ID’s Token Gateway Service enables Host Card Emulation (HCE) and ECOM network token use cases. For ECOM, Token Gateway Service provides a single interface to a variety of global or domestic network TSPs using a unified API. This single interfaces enables network tokens for different types of Token Requestors to reduce card-not-present fraud. For HCE, Token Gateway offers issuers and third-party wallet providers the ability to support the requesting and provisioning of (HCE) tokens for their own HCE (issuer) wallets. An HCE solution requires Token ID’s Secure Element in the Cloud solution in addition to Token Gateway Service for a complete HCE wallet experience.

Visa Crypto APIs enables issuers and fintechs to integrate digital currency features into their products such as crypto backed rewards.

• Enable the buying, selling and custody of digital Bitcoin (powered by our partner Anchorage).

• Provide full-service user management and ledger - with Visa maintaining user balances, transaction activity and trade order.

• Offer a customized customer service portal to help their service teams scale their support and answer customers' questions.
data.whatItDelivers:
• New revenue streams by keeping customers interested in digital currency within the client’s product ecosystem (estimated 46M of the US population already own Bitcoin and 55% plan on buying in the next 5 years).*

• Entry into crypto ecosystem with Visa as a trusted partner and brand for customers.

• The ability to implement Bitcoin in core features like rewards and savings to increase customer engagement.

Note: Product is being piloted and not generally available.

*Blockchain Capital Research 2020 and NYDIG consumer research

data.description:
Drive usage of Visa value-added services by utilizing the data and the scale of Visa’s networks to deliver context and insights to partners for effective dispute management. Verifi’s Post-Purchase Dispute Solutions leverage the Visa network to provide protection, trust and transparency to prevent and resolve customer transaction inquiries at the pre-dispute stage, as well as recover revenue lost to unwarranted disputes. Post-Purchase Dispute Solutions help increase profits for payments stakeholders and enhance customer experience.

What Is a Pre-Dispute?

A pre-dispute is a dispute that can be prevented through additional transaction information or resolved with a customer credit before it escalates to a chargeback. A dispute is considered a pre-dispute from first customer inquiry with the issuing bank until it is recognized by the seller’s acquiring bank as a chargeback. Pre-Dispute Solutions provided by Visa and Verifi include:

PREVENT. Collaborative solution enables issuers to leverage use of seller data to prevent disputes.

RESOLVE. Collaborative solution enables sellers to process refunds for fraud and non-fraud, avoiding a dispute.

data.description:
​Visa is making it easier to provide shoppers with friction-free access to payment options at checkout with the introduction of a suite of Visa’s installment solutions API’s. Issuers and merchants can offer their customers an installment payment experience at checkout using a Visa card they already have in their wallet. Cardholders have the option to divide their total purchase amount into smaller, equal payments over a defined time period on qualifying purchases—at the store and online or while traveling abroad. Visa Installment Solutions are a set of APIs that allows sellers to offer installment payment options at the point of sale using consumer’s existing (or new) credit/debit cards.

Cardholders. Supports budget management and purchase affordability, as well as increases purchase convenience and transparency.

Merchants. Drives opportunity for increased sales volume and customer loyalty and provides an enhanced check-out with a friction-free payment experience.

Acquirers. Enables Acquirers to deliver an added capability that drives conversion for their merchants.

• Give merchants the tools to increase sales and meet consumer demand for more flexible payment options.

• Unlock high volume payment potential with existing card-on-file consumers through the enablement of Visa Installments.

Issuers. Strengthens benefits offered to cardholders as part of their existing account, helping to increase card purchase volume and frequency of use.

data.description:
​VisaNet is a global network for transaction processing and is the foundation for all of Visa’s electronic payment services, including credit and debit cards, fund transfers, mobile payments, online transactions and commercial payments. Capable of handling more than 76,000 transaction messages a second and connecting millions of consumers and businesses daily, VisaNet ensures electronic payments can be delivered efficiently at the national level. VisaNet is able to provide this scalability because of several key features and capabilities:

• Single-point connectivity. VisaNet simplifies payment processing by enabling the use of a single connection and message format for authorization, clearing and settlement.

• Cost savings. By streamlining operations, VisaNet minimizes the maintenance and operational costs for network connections, back office processes, reporting and settlement.

• Customer experience and loyalty. Visa’s support services, expertise in payment processing and reliability ensure clients can deliver optimal experiences.

• Flexibility. VisaNet allows for customized connection, routing and switching preferences so clients can get the most out of their services.  Built with speed, reliability and security, VisaNet supports a diverse portfolio of products—helping to facilitate global commerce for consumers, merchants, financial institutions, partners and governments.

data.description:
​The credit card is Visa’s ‘buy now, pay later’ product. Visa’s consumer credit products grant issuing financial institutions a convenient and profitable way to provide cardholders with a credit line for short- term, unsecured financing. Consumers benefit from greater purchasing power, security, value and convenience. Visa credit cards can be used at millions of retailers around the world.

Issuers own the financial relationship with the consumer, while Visa provides the payment network. Issuers must meet the needs of a diverse set of consumers ranging from new to credit to ultra high net worth. Visa helps them meet this demand by offering a range of credit platforms that issuers can tailor to their target consumer segments.

Visa offers a variety of credit platforms around the globe: Visa Classic, Visa Gold, Visa Rewards, Visa Platinum, Visa Signature, Visa Infinite and more. In addition to Consumer Credit, Deferred Debit and Charge are also part of the credit portfolio.

With Deferred Debit, transactions create authorization holds on the customer’s account and funds are withdrawn at the end of the statement cycle.

A Charge Card does not have a revolving line; the balance must be paid in full at the end of each statement cycle.

Visa’s credit platforms that share consistent brand names, such as Visa Platinum or Visa Infinite, often have different issuer requirements, product characteristics and availability by region and country.

data.whatItDoes: Visa’s Global Accessibility Team within Global Design has created the Visa Global Accessibility Requirements (VGAR), an enterprise methodology and toolkit with a set of clear requirements that work specifically for Visa products and meet the global standards of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines. VGAR makes adoption easy for designers, developers and testers with support such as code samples, how-to videos and training. Using VGAR ensures fewer barriers for people with disabilities and better Visa products for everyone. Maintained by the Visa Accessibility team, the VGAR has been published both internally and on Visa Developer Platform to allow for easy sharing with our partners and customers.
data.whatItDelivers:
• Requirements. Clear accessibility requirements which include everything that teams need to develop accessible products with confidence.  

• Test Cases. Each requirement has a test case with tools and videos to ensure requirements have been implemented appropriately.  

• Enterprise Methodology and Toolkit. VGAR uses a maturity model to help teams improve their processes and build habits that make successfully developing accessible products more resilient and maintainable long term.  

• Multiple Platforms. VGAR on Visa Developer Platform has guidance for web and PDF, and internally there is also guidance for iOS and Android applications, HTML emails and more.

data.description:
Global Design creates best-in-class digital experiences that power commerce around the world today, and inspire what will be possible in payments tomorrow. As a core part of the Product organization, they support product design and design-as-a-service for clients.

The Global Design team has specialists across design, research, accessibility, engineering, content, strategy and operations. Using a human-centered approach to understanding problems, they turn insights into opportunities. They are your partners in making sure solutions work for everyone.

data.whatItDoes: The Design Research function within Global Design is focused on helping Visa (and Visa’s clients) win in a competitive marketplace by creating inclusive solutions that are easily understandable, accessible, and satisfying for people to use. They can help with the creation of new solutions and in refining and improving existing products. Design Research has multiple teams with staff based around the world, as well as a 1500-sq foot Inclusive Research Lab located in Austin, TX.
data.whatItDelivers:
Generative Research. Various exploratory techniques to interview and observe users individually or in groups. User Interviews are a great generative technique to help identify and define problems that need design solutions.  

Information Architecture. Digital card sorting techniques to generate and validate information architecture (terminology and organization) by product. Tree testing allows clients to check navigability for users before building out a complete site or app.    

Design Thinking and Ideation. Design thinking methodology to align stakeholders and generate storyboards, provisional personas, user process flows and/or early-stage wireframes in 1-2 day workshops.   

Testing and Evaluation. Options include heuristic (expert) reviews of sites and apps, remote and in-lab task-based usability testing on products, and a Rapid Iterative Testing and Evaluation methodology to understand user patterns and trends.  

Quantitative Research. As a complement to qualitative generative or evaluation techniques, the team conducts quantitative research to gather numerical data in support of design and business decisions.

Design Metrics and Measurement. Working with Product owners, the team defines signals and metrics based on business and inclusion goals to help products understand their users’ experiences and make improvements over time.

data.description: DCC is not a Visa service. Acquirers need to register and certify their DCC solution with Visa before they launch DCC for POS & e-comm or DCC at ATM. The DCC Guide, registration and certification forms are included on VOL. The DCC Guide contains all the DCC participation requirements. Audits at enrolled merchants (both in a card present and card not present environment) and ATMs are conducted annually to check compliance with the Visa Rules for DCC.

The International Airline Program (IAP) allows acquirers to acquire airline and on-board service providers globally rather than requiring acquiring relationships in every country where the airline flies. To become eligible for IAP, the merchant must be an international passenger airline or an on-board service provider who sells tickets or flies to more than one country. IAP helps increase operational efficiency by reducing the number of acquiring contracts and streamlining transaction depositing. IAP provides acquirers with the opportunity to service a larger portion of airline’s business, increase transaction volume and reduce operating costs.

data.whatItDoes: The Multinational Merchant Acceptance Program (MMAP) allows an acquirer to sign a merchant contract with and accept transactions from eligible multinational merchants located in countries outside the acquirer’s jurisdiction.
data.whatItDelivers: MMAP is intended to better meet the unique needs of multinational merchants for a more efficient acquiring card not present (CNP) solutions by consolidating transactions from multiple countries with a single acquirer for payment processing and settlement. It fills gaps in CNP and e-commerce acquiring by enabling merchants to receive a consistent level of service and acquiring functionality across multiple countries. Transactions look and feel local, with local settlement for acquirers and no additional fees or costs to issuers.

data.description:
​As retail banking and consumer expectations change, ATM remains a consistent and stable channel for consumers, financial institutions and digital/online-only providers.

Broad acceptance. The Visa/Plus ATM Network accepts any Visa or PLUS enabled commercial, credit, debit, prepaid or ATM card (over 3.2B cards) at over 2.6M ATMs worldwide (600K in the U.S.). The Visa/Plus ATM network delivers the reliability, security and trust synonymous with the Visa brand. Every ATM transaction that is routed through VisaNet is monitored and scored to minimize risk, build cardholder trust and drive top-of-wallet behavior.

Preferred pricing. Issuers/acquirers who elect to route all their ATM transactions through the Visa/Plus network can receive preferred pricing on interchange and switch fees. Consolidating activity to a single network eliminates redundant costs and extends the benefit of Visa’s best-in-class fraud and risk tools to all ATM transactions.

Surcharge free. Consumers dislike fees—in a Visa ATM Study (April 2020), 80% of respondents said they will do anything to avoid paying ATM fees. Visa offers different types of surcharge-free programs for consumers that clients can use to complement their current bank-owned ATM footprint.

• Any Visa/Plus cardholders has surcharge-free access to ATMs at over 500 Costco locations and 200+ college campuses.

• Issuers can elect to enroll in Plus Alliance and offer cardholders surcharge-free access at nearly 6K ATMs in popular retail locations. The Plus Alliance pay-as-you-use pricing model with no royalty fees is a low-risk investment that can balance a client’s current ATM footprint.

data.description: Today’s ATM does more than dispense cash. It's a self-service center offering features such as deposits, mini-statements, transfers, PIN changes, balance inquiries and more. Clients can turn on self-service capabilities with a simple Client Information Questionnaire (CIQ) request and future investments will cater to the growing demand for cash-in and touchless access. Enabling cardholders to do more than just cash withdrawals at the ATM reduces traffic in the branch and helps acquirers maximize the investment in an ATM fleet. Cardholders can also deposit funds to their debit or reloadable prepaid card at the ATM or make a payment to their credit card.

data.whatItDoes: Interlink is Visa’s U.S. PIN debit offering and a leading national PIN-based point-of-sale network. With more than 2.7 million acceptance locations nationwide, Interlink is accepted virtually everywhere in the U.S. where PIN-pads are deployed, giving (client) cardholders convenient access to their account. Interlink is a PIN Debit only solution, with focus on innovation and partnerships with strategic investments of new payment technologies (i.e., EMV, Tokenization).
data.whatItDelivers:
Acceptance. Interlink is accepted virtually everywhere PIN pads are present in the U.S. Cash back with purchases. Available at participating merchants. 

Convenience. Faster and easier than writing a check and safer than carrying cash. 

Recordkeeping. Monthly account statements clearly display all purchases, minimizing the risk of overspending.

Security protections, including: Visa Zero Liability policy. Protects cardholders from fraudulent purchases, even if their card is lost or stolen.

Chargeback protection. Gives cardholders the right to dispute payment for unsatisfactory goods or services.

*Available only in the United States

data.description:
Visa’s debit offerings allow consumers to safely pay for goods and services directly from funds in their checking or current accounts, providing consumers convenience, security and control. Visa debit products are accepted at tens of millions of merchant locations globally-from groceries and gas to online purchases and monthly bills. By paying with debit, cardholders can track and manage expenses while having the same protections that consumers enjoy on Visa credit cards.

Visa offers a variety of debit products around the globe: Visa Debit, Visa Electron (sunsetting), Visa Classic, Visa Gold, Visa Signature, Visa Platinum, Visa Infinite, Interlink and VPay.

Key benefits for Issuers include:

• Positive return on investment. Visa Debit can help issuers build revenue and reduce expense through cash and check displacement.

• Strengthened customer relationships. Debit has become an essential part of how consumers pay day-to-day for goods and services, with debit serving to deepen customer relationships with their financial institutions.

• Enhanced and differentiated value to cardholders. Visa Debit offers a broad suite of optional benefits, which can be customized to provide unique value to cardholders (e.g., Price Protection, Purchase Security).

• Strong brand synergy. Visa supports its debit product with brand positioning, reinforcing the message that issuer cards and services carrying the Visa name deliver a superior value proposition.

• Issuer performance support. Visa offers tools and resources to help issuers at every marketing lifecycle phase—from planning, to tracking performance, to identifying new areas for growth.

Key benefits for consumers include:

• Convenience. Using Visa Debit is faster and simpler than checks, as there is no longer a need for last-minute trips to the bank or ATM for cash. In addition, cardholders now have innovative, convenient payment options such as contactless payment via card or mobile device.

• Acceptance. For purchases big and small, Visa Debit is accepted at millions of locations worldwide.

• Control. All purchases are clearly identified on monthly statements, or via online banking, helping cardholders reduce the risk of over-spending.

• Security. Consumers can feel confident about safety when they use Visa Debit. Visa employs multiple layers of security to prevent, detect and resolve unauthorized use of cardholder information. Furthermore, if fraud should occur, Visa’s Zero Liability policy (where available) protects cardholders from liability for unauthorized charges. Multicurrency programs for Prepaid allow issuers to establish settlement BINs with Visa in up to 23 settlement currencies. These programs must be approved by regional GIGs or GPIC, depending on the program construct. ​ ​
