data.familyDescription:
​Greater consumer awareness and broader business and government adoption of prepaid payment solutions have helped to establish prepaid as a mainstream payment product, particularly among consumers who predominantly use cash, checks and vouchers.

Visa Prepaid products and services offer a range of convenient, secure and cost-effective payment alternatives for consumers, businesses and governments, while allowing FI clients and partners to tap into new revenue opportunities and enabling them to compete effectively in today’s payments environment.

Prepaid products complement existing credit and debit products:
• Credit products draw funds from a credit line (Pay Later)
• Debit products draw funds from a transaction, savings or other asset account (Pay Now)
• Prepaid products draw funds from a pre-funded card account that can be funded from a variety of sources (e.g., consumer, corporate or government) (Pay Before)

Prepaid accounts in various form factors (e.g., physical card, virtual account, digital wallet, mobile phone, wearables, etc.) provide the flexibility to meet a variety of payment needs through various channels–POS, online, phone, ATM.

Examples of Visa Prepaid Solutions:
• General Purpose Reloadable. A payment card acquired and reloaded by a consumer as a means for general use spending.
• Gift. A gift-giving solution that provides recipients with acceptance anywhere Visa cards are accepted.
• Travel. A Prepaid card with point-of-sale and ATM access that enables travelers to designate funds in advance of a trip.
• Youth/Teen. A secure and convenient way for parents to help their teens manage and save money.
• College/Student. An effective money management tool for college and university students with the ability to load and access funds easily.
• Government Disbursement. A cost-effective way for government entities to disburse funds to recipients, such as; social benefits, child support funds, pensions, tax refunds or emergency relief.
• Corporate Disbursement. Prepaid cards given to individuals as a corporate incentive, reward, rebate or for promotional purpose and for any other payments where corporate funds are distributed to consumers for their personal use.
• Payroll/Salary. A convenient electronic payment solution that enables employers to disburse payroll or salary to employees instead of via check or cash.
• Employee Benefits. Used by employers and benefit administrators to give employees convenient access to fringe benefits such as payment of healthcare, moving expenses, tolls, transit costs or meal vouchers.
• Insurance Claim. A convenient and cost-effective way for insurance carriers to make recurring or non-recurring claim payments to policy holders.
• Commercial. Cards funded by commercial or government entities to provide a means to pay for business-related goods and services. For more information, visit Commercial Prepaid in the Visa Business Solutions section.

data.description: The Visa College/Student Card is a convenient payment alternative for a segment that typically relies on cash. The solution offers a reloadable prepaid card that students can use to receive funds, pay bills or make purchases anywhere Visa is accepted, in-person or online. In partnership with a college or university, a Visa Campus prepaid program can help attract new cardholders early in their financial lifecycle. While students use the card to fund their day-to-day financial needs on and off campus, a Visa Campus prepaid card can also be used for identification, dormitory building access or can be configured as a closed loop program and applied to campus specific use such as meal plans.

Visa Employee Benefits card can help employers, benefit administrators and employees make the most of their benefit accounts by providing convenient and secure access to benefit funds through a prepaid card while helping reduce administrative costs. Visa Employee Benefits card offers prepaid solutions for employee benefits disbursements such as health care, meal and food allowances, transportation and parking reimbursements and more. Employers may partner with insurance companies, third-party administrators or other benefit program providers to disburse benefit funds electronically to participating employees through a Visa Employee Benefits card.

Visa Flexible Spending Account (U.S.)
An employer provided Visa Prepaid Card program administered by an employer/Third Party Benefit Administrator, in accordance with IRS requirements, that permits employees to set aside pre-tax dollars to pay for qualified, out-of-pocket medical expenses. Available in U.S. only.

Visa Health Reimbursement Arrangement (U.S.)
An employer-funded Visa Prepaid Card program that reimburses employees, in accordance with IRS regulations, for qualified out-of-pocket medical expenses not covered by the employer’s health care plan. Available in U.S. only.

Visa Health Savings Account (U.S.)
A Visa Prepaid Card program operated in accordance with IRS regulations that enables participants of a qualified high-deductible health plan to access funds contributed by an employee and/or employer for qualified out-of-pocket health care expenses. Available in U.S. only.

data.description: Visa General Purpose card offers consumers the convenience, security and utility of a Visa-branded prepaid card for a range of needs from general everyday spending to specific payments or uses. The card provides an easy entry-point into the financial mainstream to underserved individuals who might not have traditional banking relationships, allowing them to pay for purchases and bills, shop online and by phone or obtain cash at ATMs when they otherwise could not. Visa General Purpose cards are also used for budgeting for discretionary spending or providing funds to family members.

Visa Gift Card provides a convenient, secure and flexible an alternative to other forms of gifts. When personalized or registered, Gift cards can offer greater protection then cash or gift certificates and can be replaced if lost or stolen. This product can be used anywhere Visa is accepted. Gift cards can be customized for every occasion. Gift givers will enjoy the convenience of purchasing a Visa Gift Card at financial institutions, retail locations, malls, online or via mobile, in flexible amounts that fit their budget. Recipients will appreciate Visa Gift Cards because they can use them at millions of merchants worldwide to buy exactly what they want.

Visa Government Disbursement cards offers government agencies a highly efficient way to distribute payments. This prepaid card solutions helps government agencies streamline payments and disbursements and save millions of dollars with greater operational efficiencies, reduced check processing costs and enhanced fraud mitigation. Recipients of government payments on prepaid cards will enjoy greater security, convenience and access to financial services.

Visa Incentive Card provides organizations the opportunity to increase sales revenue and build brand recognition among their corporate and small business clients. The card offers an innovative way for clients to pay customer and employee awards and sales, replacing traditional reward checks and merchandise. Clients can quickly and cost-effectively build new, or streamline existing, incentive/promotional programs. The flexibility provided by the Visa Incentive Card allows clients to easily deliver multiple programs to meet the needs of even the most demanding client.

The Visa Insurance Claim Card gives insurance carriers the flexibility to make multiple claim disbursements on a single reloadable prepaid card or a one-time disbursement on a non-reloadable prepaid card product to help reduce cost and increase efficiencies. Claimants enjoy the security and convenience of immediate access to funds, even if they do not have a bank account and insurance carriers can reduce the time and cost of claims payments. The claim card can provide an efficient solution for disbursing a range of insurance payments including workers’ compensation, property and casualty, disability and auto.

A Visa Payroll card provides employers with a convenient and economical alternative to cash and paper checks for disbursing salaries and wages. Since funds are electronically distributed, a Visa Payroll card can help businesses reduce their payroll processing costs associated with cash and paper checks (e.g., production, handling, storage and postage) and reduce fraud expenses related to lost, stolen or duplicated checks. Once employees obtain their salary and wages via the Visa Payroll card from their employer, they can use the card to withdraw cash, pay bills or make purchases anywhere Visa is accepted, in-person or online. With a Visa Payroll card, employees can receive and manage their money more securely and effectively than cash and paper checks.

Visa ReadyLink (VRL) is Visa’s load service, allowing debit and prepaid cardholders with eligible Visa Classic or Visa Business cards to add funds to their accounts at participating merchant locations and ATMs. With the digital expansion of traditional financial institutions, the rapid growth of online banks as well as the popularity of reloadable prepaid cards; many of these issuers do not have physical locations to allow their cardholders to make deposits. Visa ReadyLink provides cardholders immediate access to funds loaded for use. Transactions in Visa ReadyLink are processed through VisaNet for authorization and settlement, enabling all participants to use their existing Visa processing capabilities. VRL is an optional transaction for both issuers and acquirers. Any Visa Issuer can enroll their program to participate in VRL; participation is not mandatory. Available in U.S. only.

Visa Travel card is a reloadable prepaid solution for leisure or business travelers looking for a safer and convenient way to carry and use funds they have set aside for travel. Travel cards offer customers an efficient way to manage their funds while traveling and may help them secure favorable currency exchange rates. Funds may be loaded in local or foreign currencies and can be used for domestic and international transactions at millions of merchant locations where Visa cards are accepted. Cardholders can also access their funds 24-hours a day in local currency at ATMs worldwide. Visa Travel cards offer travel-specific benefits, such as including lost/stolen card reporting, cardholder inquiry services and emergency card replacement services.

Issuers may choose to use the Visa TravelMoney brand name (may not be available in some countries) to help market and position their portfolio and offer additional benefits to cardholders on their Visa Travel prepaid programs.

Visa Multi-Currency Solution enables issuers to settle with Visa in different currencies and provide cardholders the ability to purchase and load different currencies on Visa Prepaid cards to facilitate transactions in the local currency while traveling internationally. For additional information on the Visa Multi-Currency Solution, please refer to the Treasury as a Service section or contact your Visa Account Representative.

Visa Vale offers innovative solutions to support disbursement of employee benefits in countries where local legislation provides tax benefits to companies that grant their employees benefits that pay for basic necessities such as food, transportation, tolls, gasoline, culture, uniforms, school supplies, etc. With Visa Vale prepaid cards, employees can make purchases at affiliated restaurants, supermarkets and gas stations without access to cash through ATMs to ensure compliance with local laws and regulations. Further, Visa Vale helps companies simplify their payment processes, reduce handling time and operating costs and streamline the disbursement of benefits to their employees. Available in select countries in LAC, except Brazil.

Visa Youth/Teen prepaid card offers a simple, safe and convenient way to help teenagers manage their money and develop responsible financial practices while keeping parents informed, involved and in control. The product is issued in the teen’s name with the parent/guardian as the legal account holder. Cards can be used in-store and online, everywhere Visa is accepted.

data.whatItDoes:
Decision Manager keeps fraud low, customer satisfaction high, and revenue flowing. This is our flagship product. It allows businesses to make risk adjustments to stop fraud before it starts and helps detect more good orders quickly-delivering greater insights for your business and adding value to every transaction. 

Businesses can adjust risk parameters and business rules without any IT coding effort in order to:

• Prevent fraud loss by stopping fraud closer to its inception.

• Ensure positive customer experiences by detecting more good orders quickly.

• Lower operating costs by reducing manual order review.

• Control results with real-time financial and operating performance reports.

• Tune and optimize operations without reliance on IT resources.
data.whatItDelivers:
Decision Manager is a fraud detection and risk management tool that allows businesses to accept or reject incoming orders based on a variety of sophisticated risk models. It comes available fully integrated with payment management or available as a standalone service. With secure proven Visa-grade systems, ML and AI actively informed by over 68 billion transactions and global experts with deeper payments knowhow. Clients will never be constrained by a one-size-fits-all view of the world, as it's always designed to fit them. Decision Manager delivers bigger insights.

Single, flexible integration to rapidly scale, customize and secure clients' unique customer experiences. Clients can deliver customer payment experiences as unique as their business while getting as many good payments as possible - adding value to every transaction. 

Never static. Always data driven. Battle-hardened machine learning with artificial intelligence experience helps clients add precision to maximize good transactions. Without turning down legitimate transactions, using a more comprehensive solution that combines both human and artificial intelligence can lead to a better customer experiences. 

Visa experience, security, robust data and knowhow on a global scale to capture more revenue. Because of our time in the industry, we have more experience, more data, more expertise and even more partnerships to draw on. Optimizing our clients' revenues by the minute. 

Decision Manager provides additional capabilities like Decision Manager Replay. Built on the existing Decision Manager platform, it offers access to a tuning system that can increase the accuracy, speed and integration of fraud prevention strategies. It is useful to plan for peak seasons, reduce manual review, or to communicate differences in various fraud strategies. 

Score Builder. A feature of Decision Manager, Score Builder allows merchants to improve their detection accuracy by customizing the industry-proven Cybersource risk score or to create one of their own. Out of the box, Score Builder increases the accuracy of traditional fraud rules, while minimizing complexity, by empowering businesses to adjust an industry statistical risk assessment to match a score to their specific needs.

Rules Suggestion Engine and Decision Manager Replay are two other capabilities built into Decision Manager. This streamlines the analytic effort required to establish and re-tune fraud rules to improve operational efficiency. 

Decision Manager has integrated a variety of industry-leading third-party data sources to ensure businesses have necessary resources to validate transactional information such as identity, national identification, or further risk insight. These are referred to as our Fraud Management Data Services. They include: Emailage, Ekata, Perseuss, Credilink and Targus Info. 

CardinalCommerce provides Integrated Payor Authentication. Cardinal eliminates fraud while increasing sales and reducing consumer friction in eCommerce. They are a wholly-owned subsidiary of Visa, and operates the largest authentication network in the world. Through One Connection to drive digital commerce, we enable friction-free, technology-neutral authentication and alternative payment services (including digital wallets and mobile commerce services).

data.whatItDoes:
Fraud Management Essentials is a lightweight and powerful fraud prevention tool designed for small to mid-market businesses and leverages the proven success of Cybersource’s industry-leading solution, Decision Manager. With Fraud Management Essentials, sellers can take advantage of machine learning while retaining control over their own risk tolerance. This is a robust and flexible fraud management solution tailored for small to mid-market sellers — but one that also benefits from the scale, security and analytics of Visa and Cybersource, enabling growth from micro to enterprise on a single platform.

• Integrates with the Cybersource Global Gateway and secured by Visa.

• Leverage the largest card transaction data set with a plug and play solution.

• Access to 24/7 customer support.

• Pre-configured fraud settings based on Decision Manager’s machine learning platform.

• AVS and CVV filters along with Risk Score to match desired risk tolerance.

• Configure standard, geo-location, velocity and threshold rules.

• Mange negative, positive and review lists based on their fraud strategy.

• Easy-to-use and informative dashboard provides visibility and decision insights.

• Actionable insights into suspicious payments and rule performance.
data.whatItDelivers:
Fraud Management Essentials helps businesses minimize costly fraud attacks. With ready-to-go fraud filters, you can automatically monitor orders and provide a seamless customer experience. It is a lightweight and powerful fraud prevention tool designed to meet the needs of small to mid-market businesses. The service leverages powerful computer models using machine learning and hundreds of validation tests to prevent fraudulent transactions. 

Fraud Management Essentials provides the scale, security, and analytics of Visa and Cybersource. It helps to protect businesses from card testing, payment fraud, and common abuse scenarios, and enables growth from micro to enterprise on a single platform. Setup is easy with preconfigured settings, so you can get up and running right away and then make informed decisions via a user-friendly dashboard.

• Accurately detect fraud with reliable screening. Powerful computer models use machine learning and hundreds of validation tests to automatically stop fraudulent transactions out of the box.

• Accelerate setup with built-in fraud rules. Preconfigured settings screen for fraud, so clients can get started right away.

• Reduce chargeback and declined authorization. Save time and resources with easy adjustments clients can make based on their risk tolerance.

• Make informed decisions with a user-friendly dashboard. Clients can Spend more time on running their business and less time dealing with fraudsters using the dashboard to accept or reject the transaction.

• Reduce fraud, without adding friction. Help preserve a frictionless customer experience by allowing good orders to pass through without interruption where each transaction is evaluated in milliseconds.

data.description: The Digital Authentication Framework (DAF) is part of a global initiative, Visa Digital Performance Drive, to help expand Visa’s authentication rules and processing requirements to support a consistent and verifiable set of transaction data that can increase confidence and facilitate risk decisions to help drive increased approval rates and lower fraud. This framework is designed to elevate the performance of Merchants and Token Requestors’ Card Not Present token transactions without introducing layers of friction in the customer experience.
data.whatItDoes: The Digital Authentication Framework (DAF) aims to provide a consistent and verifiable set of transaction data that can increase confidence and facilitate risk decisions which can help lead to increased approval rates and lower fraud. Token Requestors that meet the framework criteria on qualified authenticated token transactions will receive fraud dispute protection.

data.whatItDoes:
Visa Secure (3DS) is messaging protocol that enables consumer authentication on e-commerce transactions. 3-D Secure gives Issuers a way to authenticate the cardholder when shopping online, enabling verification of the cardholder’s identity before the transaction is sent for authorization. This additional layer of security helps prevent unauthorized use of cards and protects e-commerce Merchants and Issuers from exposure to fraud.

Visa Secure is Visa’s program that governs Visa transactions using the 3-D Secure standard. The program provides the rules and policies Merchants and Issuers must follow to invoke authentication for e-commerce transactions. Visa developed the original version of the protocol (3-D Secure 1.0) in 1999 and is has been widely adopted globally.

In October 2016, in conjunction with the payment card networks and other industry participants, EMVCo published an updated version of the specification, EMV 3DS (a.k.a. 3-D Secure 2.0). EMV 3DS provides several improvements including a streamlined user experience, greater data exchange for enhanced risk-based authentication and support for mobile devices.

In December 2018, EMVCo enhanced the current specification version to create EMV 3-D Secure 2.2 which addresses Europe’s Second Payment Services Directive (PSD2) exemptions for Strong Consumer Authentication (SCA) and promotes an optimized consumer experience (i.e. in-app authentication such as biometric authentication on mobile devices).
data.whatItDelivers:
• Improved user experience. Visa Secure gives Merchants the capability to better integrate the authentication process into the shopping experience and provides a more user-friendly authentication experience for consumers, while maintaining security.

• More data to reduce unnecessary friction. EMV 3-D Secure facilitates greater data exchange between Merchant and Issuer to enhance risk-based authentication (RBA) models so that only the riskiest transactions (typically <5%) are stepped up for additional cardholder verification,* such as requiring the cardholder to input a one-time-passcode. The rest are authenticated "invisibly" without cardholder friction.

• Flexible device and channel support. While 3DS 1.0 only supports PC browser-based authentication, the new version (EMV 3-D Secure) includes updates and enhancements that promote a smoother and more consistent user experience across multiple payment channels, including mobile web, in-app and digital wallet payments. The most current specification (EMV 3-D Secure 2.2) offers the best customer experience when purchasing in-app and on smartphones while also providing the ability to request specific exemptions for Strong Consumer Authentication (SCA) included in Europe’s PSD2.

*Does not apply to mandated regions

data.whatItDoes:
​Cardinal Consumer Authentication (CCA) is a hosted Merchant-plug-in (MPI) and 3DS Server that provides rules-based authentication programs from card networks. CCA supports the original 3DS 1.0.2 and new EMV 3-D Secure protocols. CCA validates cardholders with their card issuing bank during digital commerce purchases or non-payment requests, regardless of the type of device they use for the transaction that needs authentication.

As use cases for EMV 3DS support new features, Visa continues to evolve and innovate to deliver other program offerings, such as data solutions which do not require authentication.Cardinal's rules engine allows Merchants to create rules from data points collected during the purchase request. The rules engine determines when and how to use authentication or data only solutions to reduce fraud and increase authorizations, all with an improved consumer experience.  

CCA meets many two-factor authentication-specific government mandates, such as Europe's Second Payment Service Directive (PSD2) requirement for Strong Customer Authentication (SCA). With over 20 years of experience in putting authentication first, Cardinal has the expertise to help Merchants and Issuers create an optimized authentication strategy. This strategy can span across browsers, mobile web and native applications, voice-controlled devices, gaming consoles and the future of the Internet of Things (IoT). 

By using CCA layered with fraud tools, Merchants can access program benefits from the card networks such as reducing fraud, increasing authorizations, improving order acceptance and compliance with regulatory mandates (such as PSD2 SCA in Europe). CCA focuses on optimizing the consumer experience, regardless of the consumer’s device type during checkout. With CCA, Merchants have control over when and how authentication is requested, based on their transaction risk thresholds, control data points passed into Cardinal and where the transaction is originating. In EMV 3DS, the merchant can ask an issuer to force a challenge or ask them not to.
data.whatItDelivers:
• ​Network agnostic. Supporting 3DS 1.0.2 and EMV 3-D Secure across all card networks, with 20 years of authentication innovation experience and the flexibility to route transactions properly, based on protocol compatibility between merchant and issuer.

• Merchant agnostic. Capability for offering a variety of integration solutions for customized connectivity: JavaScript (Standard), API, Hybrid and our Cardinal Mobile SDKs (Android and iOS).

• Customized rules. Allowing Merchants to implement a rules strategy based on data points and risk decisions to leverage when and how they would like authentication to occur. Flexibility for rules to be created from any data point sent to Cardinal, including custom fields. Rules can be applied before or during an authentication request.

• Use cases. Support for payment, non-payment, recurring, installment, add-card, split shipments, browser, app, IoT and data only transaction types, using a combination of data elements working within our integration methods.

• Regulatory support. Certified to EMV 3DS version 2.2, and Mastercard version 2.1 extensions to meet the growing requirements for strong customer authentication and use of exemptions to the PSD2 SCA requirement in Europe.

• Online portal. Contains applications for User Administration and Reporting.

• User administration. Provides user access and feature management to the online portal.

• Reporting. Offers real-time access to summary reporting, and transaction level detail views into data related to authentication, with over 30 data points for reference.

• Customer support and escalation. Capitalizing on real-time data collection, alerts, monitoring and anomaly detection of the ecosystem 24/7/365 with access to an online support and ticketing system for all customers.

data.whatItDoes:
​Visa Consumer Authentication Service (VCAS) is a data-driven hosted Access Control Server (ACS) solution designed to support an Issuer’s 3-D Secure authentication strategies. Its risk-based authentication capabilities work behind the scenes to evaluate each transaction based on shared data to reduce checkout friction, while providing greater levels of security.

VCAS is a 3-D Secure based consumer authentication solution that uses a data-driven approach to help reduce fraud and false declines and increase authorizations while maintaining a streamlined consumer experience. At the heart of VCAS is its risk-based authentication capabilities which provide Issuers the ability to define their own rules and levels of risk using Visa’s state of the art fraud detection capabilities via the VCAS Risk Score. VCAS features a configurable user interface, allowing flexible controls and functionalities. This allows Issuers to create, manage and monitor their authentication strategies in real-time, to combat fraud and support enhanced data exchange for better risk decisioning. VCAS also provides Issuers with strong risk-based authentication capabilities where every transaction is evaluated for its risk potential, and most transactions can be completed without the need of further authentication. In cases where a step-up is warranted, VCAS supports multiple dynamic authentication methods to meet client needs. 

As part of the API-based integration method, Visa Real-time Data Exchange (VRDX), VCAS enables Issuers’ step-up strategy for 3DS. Issuers integrated with RDX can participate in authentication decision making in real-time and leverage a variety of dynamic authentication methods such as biometric, Out-of-Band Biometrics (OOB) and Visa Token Services (VTS) when they are warranted. 

VCAS also offers the Authentication Data Exchange (ADX) API that delivers authentication results, along with other ancillary data, to Issuers’/processors’ authorization host system to be used in authorization decision making. This is a real-time service where transaction-level data can be delivered to the Issuer’s selected end point before the transaction even appears for authorization.

VCAS uses network-wide intelligence to assess the risk of a transaction in real-time, using predictive risk analysis and enhanced inputs, including, but not limited to, device info, transaction data, purchase behaviors, historical trends, etc.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Designed to support an Issuer’s authentication strategies within their 3-D Secure program, VCAS allows for real-time risk assessment based on various inputs including spending patterns and transaction information. This differentiated capability is unique to Visa in which competitors such as Mastercard do not have an equivalent service.

• Responsiveness. VCAS enables the vast majority of low-risk transactions to go through without authentication, and requiring additional information only as the risk level increases.

• Flexibility. The service supports a wide range of authentication methods, including dynamic authentication data.

• Convenience. VCAS makes low-risk transactions easy, fast and frictionless for consumers.

data.whatItDoes:
​Advanced Identity Score (AIS) is a two-digit FCRA-compliant ID fraud score aimed at preventing fraud losses at the point of credit application. AIS combines Visa’s AI with proprietary data to help clients predict application fraud.  AIS leverages the proprietary, comprehensive data, including many data elements not captured by credit bureaus or alternative solutions in market, to distinguish low-risk and high-risk applications while reducing false positives.

• Network agnostic - can be used on any type of credit application, including credit card applications for all brands (not just Visa), business/personal loans, auto loans, installments, etc.

• A two-digit FCRA-compliant ID fraud score aimed to prevent fraud losses at the point of application.

• Uses AI and machine learning to verify the applicant and predict fraud.

• Generates a real-time risk score for each application predicting account behavior over the next 12 months.

• Aimed to help distinguish low-risk and high-risk applications while reducing false positives-confidently advancing good applications through.
data.whatItDelivers:
​This powerful insight into the fraud risk of applications helps organizations to:

• Reduce fraud rates while handling fewer suspect applications.

• Reduce losses.

• Reduce back office expenses.

• Enhance customer experience.

data.whatItDoes: Issuer’s Clearinghouse Service (ICS) is a risk management product to enable card Issuers, and their agents, to improve the fraud detection process and help stop fraud before it occurs. ICS delivers alerts identifying risky credit card applications based upon Issuer-defined triggers. These alerts are highly predictive of credit and fraud risk.
data.whatItDelivers: ICS is network agnostic and works across all brands—not just Visa—and ICS provides alerts to Issuers based on velocity and reported fraud based on data attributes (e.g., SSN, address, phone number). These alerts are generated only when specific data attributes exceed the velocity thresholds defined by the Issuer. Valuable information that can be used to make application decisions is provided to the Issuer when an alert is triggered.

data.whatItDoes: Prepaid Clearinghouse Service (PCS) is a risk management product to enable prepaid card issuers and their agents, to improve the fraud detection process and   help stop fraud before it occurs. PCS is a centralized database that consolidates, tracks and aggregates prepaid card enrollments, loads, confirmed or suspicion of fraud and provisional credit requests. This information is translated into meaningful alerts to better detect and help prevent identity theft and other fraud schemes. Participating financial institutions have access to a holistic view of prepaid fraud across the industry, enabling more efficient and effective fraud reduction.
data.whatItDelivers: PCS is network agnostic and works across all brands—not just Visa— and PCS provides alerts to prepaid card Issuers based on velocity and reported fraud based on data attributes (e.g., SSN, address, phone number). These alerts are generated only when specific data attributes exceed the velocity thresholds defined by the Issuer. Valuable information that can be used to make application decisions is provided to the issuer when an alert is triggered.

data.whatItDoes:
​Visa Advanced Authorization (VAA) is a powerful network processing tool that helps Issuers prevent fraud before it happens. By analyzing the network for emerging fraud patterns and identifying transactions that don’t fit individual usage patterns, VAA facilitates automatic decisioning at the time of sale.

Extending the power of Visa Global Processing, VAA uses patented risk technologies and processes to deliver a real-time inflight risk score on Visa authorizations and includes three key components:

• A risk score that evaluates each transaction to indicate the degree of fraud risk.

• The Compromised Account Risk Condition Code (CARCC) that provides a predictive fraud risk score for the impacted accounts associated with high-risk compromise events (optional add-on feature).

• A Compromised Event Reference (CER) ID that indicates accounts associated with a specific compromise event (optional add-on feature).
data.whatItDelivers:
• ​Security. Visa Advanced Authorization has been proven to reduce fraud by providing in-flight fraud detection at the point of purchase with key network level predictive and geographically specific data from VisaNet and providing information on compromised events and accounts.

• Efficiency. Visa Advanced Authorization improves throughput and risk management by helping clients optimize their authorization performance such as approving more low risk transactions while capturing more fraud.

• Growth. Visa Advanced Authorization helps reduce fraud and false declines by building more trust with consumers and increasing overall card usage.

data.whatItDoes:
​Visa Risk Manager is an intelligent decisioning solution powered by VisaNet. By utilizing the data collected through VisaNet, Visa Risk Manager is able to deliver unprecedented risk insights and turn these insights into actions to dynamically respond to fraud before it occurs.

Visa Risk Manager leverages the power of Visa Advanced Authorization and more than 70 other transaction parameters and puts them into action. With Visa Risk Manager, Issuers have more control and flexibility to manage to their risk strategies and risk tolerance.
data.whatItDelivers:
​This web-based tool provides Issuers with the following features:

• Action. Visa Risk Manager’s real-time decisioning efficiently declines high-risk transactions at the point of sale.

• Customization. Create strategies for managing fraud risk according to each Issuer’s unique and evolving needs. Rules can be set at any time to decline high-risk purchases and token provisioning requests, or to flag and prioritize suspicious purchases that require further investigation.

• Speed. Issuers can create, test and activate rules within moments. The tool’s rule testing feature helps determine impact before rules are activated.

• Efficiency. Alerts can be generated for transactions requiring additional oversight and queued for streamlined offline review.

• Flexibility. Visa Risk Manager can be used as a stand-alone tool or integrated into existing systems. Using Visa Risk Manager APIs, Issuers can automate communication between back office systems and Visa Risk Manager.

• Savings. By automating fraud detection, clients have the opportunity to free up valuable resources for other tasks.    

Optional add-on feature: Visa Strategy Manager.

data.whatItDoes: This suite of predictive models use transaction and authorization data to generate scores for the likelihood that a cardholder or business will become delinquent in the next 12 months. For cardholders, data analyzed includes spend volume and categories, spend stability and authorization declines. For businesses, data analyzed include acceptance patterns, growth, stability, size and loyalty of their customer base.
data.whatItDelivers:
The Cardholder Transaction Score (CTS) is a PAN-level credit score that helps Issuers expand access to credit (approve more customers, better cross-sell), improve efficiency and reduce losses by enhancing and refining their risk evaluation methods.   

The Business Credit Score (BCS) leverages acceptance data (POS transactions) to predict the delinquency risk of small Merchants. This helps issuing and acquiring clients increase small business credit card origination, expand access to working capital loans for small businesses and improve ongoing small Merchant credit risk management. 

Both scores can be offered as standalone products to be used at the account level (via a real-time secure API)  or can be offered as part of the Credit Cycle Management Playbook, a bundle of products and services available through Visa Consulting and Analytics. The Playbook helps Issuers prepare for and respond to credit turns. The playbook, currently available in the U. S., includes custom research from Visa economists, strategy recommendations from our consultants, our proprietary Consumer Resiliency Index and Business Health Index and custom dashboards.

data.familyDescription: These solutions use Visa’s data to score credit risk for issuing and acquiring clients to improve underwriting, portfolio management strategies such as credit line increase programs, cross-sell of lending products and working capital management for small businesses. These products also support portfolio monitoring and benchmarking to identify geographic or sectoral areas of risk. Finally, Visa enables Acquirers and those operating on their behalf to identify and search for Merchants who have been terminated for cause.

data.description:
Multi-Currency Solution offers flexible settlement configurations for clients enabling Issuers to settle in more than one currency. Eligible debit/prepaid portfolios are subject to annual cross-border volume thresholds and fees associated with the program. The Multi-Currency Solution is subject to approval by regional deal review and pricing committees.

Bespoke Multicurrency Settlement offers flexibility for issuers and acquirers to settle in multiple currencies.

OBO Virtual Account Settlement is for clients who wish to settle in a bespoke suite of currencies without having to open and manage their own nostros. It is available for multicurrency issuer programs.

Available through the Currencycloud suite of APIs, Virtual Account Multi-Currency Settlement will enable clients to set up the Multi-Currency Solution (MCS) configuration without opening additional bank accounts. The virtual accounts are denominated in the currency of the MCS program, auto reconcile and decrease operational overhead for client treasury teams. Virtual Account Multi-Currency Settlement requires Issuer Currencycloud API integration.

Note: Issuer program approval required.

data.familyDescription: Settlement Services provide more flexibility in the number of currencies used for settlement operations.

data.whatItDoes: The Visa Commercial Choice Program (VCCP) is a suite of capabilities and services that allows financial institutions (on behalf of their commercial card customers) and suppliers (and/or merchants) to establish flexible client-to-client fee agreements. VCCP is intended to expand commercial card acceptance within the large and middle-market space as well as for the public sector.
data.whatItDelivers:
Acceptance growth. Unlocking new channels of acceptance by facilitating flexible client-to-client interchange fee agreements with suppliers.   

Rescuing lost volume. Regain volume from suppliers who have canceled. 

Attrition prevention. Protect and maintain existing suppliers. 

Increased control. Issuers can directly negotiate interchange rates with suppliers. 

Improved customer satisfaction. Increase value of commercial card programs by ensuring all parties in the payments ecosystem can see the value in card acceptance.

*Available only in the United States

data.whatItDoes: The B2B Virtual Travel Product is considered a travel payable solution and targets Online Travel Agency (OTA) clients that can be a small business, middle/large and multinational corporations. Virtual accounts are a primary tool used to facilitate payments. They are single-use accounts where there is no physical card. In this space there are Issuers, Acquirers and OTAs that create their own version of a virtual account and conduct online air travel payments.
data.whatItDelivers: The B2B Virtual Travel Product allow OTAs to pay for travel inventory from suppliers, with control rules to match the amount to pay, full visibility of the transaction data and flexibility to create, modify and cancel the virtual card before being authorized by the supplier. In addition, the solution includes all the benefits of the card network such as global scalability, charge-back rules protection and security.

data.whatItDoes: Visa Fleet enables organizations to make confident fleet related purchases within Visa’s large Merchant network. Visa Fleet is accepted at over 1.6 million fleet Merchants in the U.S., making fleet related purchases easier than closed loop fuel cards at Merchants such as repair shops, auto parts, tires stores and car washes. Fleet cards are assigned to vehicles/employees to manage fuel and vehicle costs for corporate vehicles.

Visa Fleet Enhanced Data Quality reporting monitors all Visa fleet transactions and evaluates data quality via dashboard, reporting and data quality. Visa plans to publish an Enhanced Fleet EMV Spec that leverages the expected industry standard fleet approach.

data.whatItDoes: Purchasing Cards provide corporate clients a comprehensive solution to pay for business expenses, operating goods and services, thereby reducing processing and transaction costs and eliminating purchase orders, invoices and checks.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Companies can realize benefits such as:

• Streamlined purchase and accounting processes by eliminating purchase orders invoices and checks.

• Reduced processing and transaction costs through process automation, supplier management and employee empowerment.

• Increased internal controls by standardizing and automating business processes and monitoring compliance with spend policies and procedures.

data.whatItDoes: Small Business Credit is designed to support clients in providing competitive and differentiated payment solutions to help meet the needs of small businesses. Small Business Credit can help clients address the needs of businesses of all types—ranging from new, emerging small businesses to more established businesses—by endowing them with greater control of business expenses through Small Business Credit. Issuing banks own the financial relationship with the cardholder, while Visa provides the payment product. Issuing banks must meet the needs of a diverse set of cardholder needs, ranging from new to credit to ultra-high net worth. Visa helps them meet this demand by offering a range of credit platforms that issuing banks can tailor to their target segment. Small Business Credit includes sub-products including Signature, Infinite, Gold and Platinum (availability varies by region). Credit accounts in various form factors (e.g., physical card, virtual account, digital wallet, mobile phone, wearables, etc.) provide the flexibility to meet a variety of payment needs through various channels: POS, online, phone and ATM.
data.whatItDelivers:
• ​Product migration opportunities to better align with changing needs.

• Core card benefits funded by Visa including Purchase Security, Extended Protection and Auto Rental Collision Damage Waiver.*

• Client-funded optional benefits and rewards tailored towards the unique needs of small businesses.

• Flexibility to create unique, customized payment products.

• Visa SavingsEdge.

• Visa Merchant Offers.

*Visa funded. Varies by region

data.footNotes: *Benefits vary by region. For more details contact the regional subject matter expert.
data.whatItDoes: Small Business Debit helps small business owners obtain convenient access to ATMs worldwide and access their business checking account without having to carry cash or write a check, all while offering many of the same features and benefits as Small Business Credit. Debit accounts are available in various form factors (e.g., physical card, virtual account, digital wallet, mobile phone, wearables, etc.) in order to provide the flexibility to meet a variety of payment needs through various channels-POS, online, phone, ATM.
data.whatItDelivers:
Visa offers a variety of debit products around the globe: Visa Business Debit, Visa Gold, Visa Platinum and Visa Infinite. 

Key benefits for issuers include:

• Excellent return on investment. Helps Issuers build revenue through cash and check displacement.

 • Strengthened customer relationship. Allows clients to cross-sell other products, including loans, online banking service and credit cards. Drives up the overall profitability.

 • Strong brand synergy. Visa heavily supports debit product in marketing and advertising, reinforcing the message that Issuer cards and services carrying the Visa name deliver a superior value proposition. 

• Comprehensive support. Visa offers tools and resources to help Issuers at every marketing lifecycle phase. 

• Exceptional risk management. Features include: Advance authorization, Cross-Visa-brand compliance, fraud reimbursement/compliance and Cardholder Information Security Program.

 • Value-added benefits program. Can help differentiate an Issuer’s Visa Business Debit Card in a highly competitive market. The program includes core card benefits giving cardholders security and protection. Visa can help Issuers review, select and implement core and option card benefits to help attract cardholders and drive usage and loyalty.   

Key Benefits for Small Businesses include:

• Cash flow management. All purchases are clearly identified on monthly statements or online banking portals to help minimize the risk of overspending. Simplified record keeping and money management means small businesses can access their checking accounts to pay business expenses without the hassle of writing checks or making last-minute trips to the bank or ATM for cash.

 • Efficiency tools. Reporting tools like Visa Spend Clarity for Business not only help businesses track, manage and analyze expenses more effectively, but also allow business owners to keep their personal expenses separate from their business.

 • Rewards and savings. Exclusive programs like the Visa SavingsEdge and Global Merchant Offers Program provide relevant business rewards and negotiated best-in-market Merchant discounts.

 • Security and protection. Small business owners can count on multiple layers of security from Visa and their Issuer to prevent, detect and resolve unauthorized used of cardholder information. If fraud should occur, small business owners' exposure is limited due to features like Visa Liability Waiver, Visa Zero Liability and Lost and Stolen Card Reporting services.* 

• Payment and purchasing convenience. Worldwide acceptance at millions of Merchants Visa offers business owners unrivaled convenience in how they pay for business-related supplies or services, be it online, by phone or through the mail.

*Benefits vary by region. For more details contact the regional subject matter expert.

data.whatItDoes:
​Visa Commercial Prepaid cards are a convenient way for businesses and their employees to make business purchases. These prepaid products can be used to pay for goods or services online or in-store, business-related travel expenses or other business expenditures (e.g., office and meeting supplies). 

Commercial Prepaid cards are often issued as Corporate (for travel and entertainment expenses), Purchasing or Business (for small businesses/sole proprietors) cards. They are owned and funded by public or private sector business entities for business spend and are different from corporate-funded prepaid cards that are used for disbursing funds to employees and/or consumers (e.g., payroll/salary, incentives, rewards) for personal spend. 

Visa Commercial Prepaid solutions can help businesses simplify and streamline their expenses by providing a comprehensive picture of their organization’s spending, data-driven insights to enable strategic decisions (e.g., sourcing), track and control employee spending, ensure compliance with organization policies and improve performance. 

With broad appeal to small, medium and large businesses, Visa Commercial Prepaid cards can complement existing commercial credit and debit portfolios, while offering an additional source of revenue and helping clients grow their customer base.
data.whatItDelivers:
​There are three primary categories:

• Corporate Prepaid. Issued to employees or contractors of commercial entities (both public and private) and used primarily to pay for business-related travel and entertainment expenses.

• Purchasing Prepaid. Issued to employees or contractors of commercial entities (both public and private) and used to pay for general business expenses.

• Business Prepaid. Issued to employees, contractors, sole proprietors or self-employed individuals and used to pay for business travel and general business expenses for small businesses. For information on Visa's Load service in the U.S., visit Visa ReadyLink in the Prepaid section.

data.whatItDoes: The Visa Multinational Program (MNP) is the framework that enables Issuers around the world to offer global commercial solutions to their multinational corporate clients. These solutions can be provided directly or through a network of participating banks.
data.whatItDelivers:
​The Visa MNP encompasses a variety of Visa capabilities, which may be used as standalone services or in conjunction with each other. There are two core approaches to cross-border issuing under the Visa MNP: 

• Direct issuance. The issuance of Visa Commercial Card Products to multinational corporate clients in a country outside the Issuer’s home market. Issuing BIN account range indicators localize the issued commercial solutions to the multinational corporate client country.

• Indirect issuance or "partner bank" issuance. A lead bank forms a relationship with a partner bank located in another country for the purpose of issuing Visa commercial card products to its multinational clients.

These solutions are supported through multinational data consolidation capabilities as well as tools and products that help improve expense management, procure-to-pay processes and other business-to-business commerce needs, as requested by the commercial organizations.

data.whatItDoes: Business Payments Network (BPN) is a platform owned and operated by Billtrust that routes electronic payments from corporate buyers (and the Accounts Payable automation/Financial Institution providers who issue those payments) to commercial suppliers. The payment type is dictated by supplier’s preferred method of acceptance (ACH, virtual card, etc.) and their terms of acceptance. This product allows suppliers to have virtually touch-free payments, reducing manual processing. Visa is the exclusive reseller of the Business Payments Network.
data.whatItDelivers:
BPN allows the user to: 

• Send faster payments

• Access a robust supplier directory

• Boost acceptance rates

• Increase electronic spend and lower costs

• Gain transparency

• Reduce IT impact for product implementation

• Reduce onboarding effort by contracting directly with Visa

data.whatItDoes:
A large percentage of commercial spend is currently done outside of client programs, creating inefficiencies and added costs and complexities for organizations. Businesses are looking for solutions that provide them with control, efficiency and visibility across all of their spending. 

Visa Commercial Payis a powerful payment solution that works across travel, mobile and B2B payments, streamlining business spend. Visa Commercial Pay leverages the flexibility and security of virtual accounts, enabling instant issuance, automated spend management and complete visibility across all business spend.

• Travel. Centrally manage all travel transactions with global consistency (hotel, air, car) and seamless integration into an organization’s travel policy and designated Travel Management Company (TMC).

• Mobile. Instant issuance of virtual accounts into a mobile app, allowing a business to efficiently manage all on-demand spend—both business travel and B2B (e.g., incidentals, office supplies, marketing, insurance, meals and parking).  The mobile app allows for full account management by any authorized individual and allows for eCommerce or contactless transactions.

• B2B. Visa Commercial Payoffers an easy-to-use UI, automatic processing, quick onboarding to help organizations manage their supplier payments in a consistent manner.  Additionally, this solution allows for key functionality such as Straight-Through-Processing (STP) and integration into key e-marketplaces.
data.whatItDelivers: Visa Commercial Pay delivers the efficiency of a single solution with the power to address a wide range of business spending.  It helps organizations gain broader visibility to their total spend, automate much of the accounting and reconciliation processes and minimize many of the costly and time-consuming steps such as employee expense reimbursement.

data.description: Guaranteed OUR or GOUR Service is an opt-in service that allows Participant Banks on the Visa B2B Connect network to deliver full value for their customers for eligible out-of-network payments.
data.whatItDoes: Visa B2B Connect is a multilateral network that enables banks to send and receive cross border payments on behalf of their corporate clients. Guaranteed OUR or GOUR Service was launched recently   for Visa B2B Connect network participants as an opt-in service for out-of-network payment.

Visa B2B Connect is a multilateral network created to remove friction and time spent on cross-border corporate payments by facilitating transactions from the bank of origin directly to the beneficiary bank. The network increases visibility into the transaction flow for transactions between participants, giving buyers and suppliers an opportunity to track the status of payments from the originating bank to the destination bank in near real time and in a cost-effective manner.
data.whatItDelivers:
Visa B2B Connect delivers B2B cross-border payments that are predictable, secure and cost-effective for financial institutions and their corporate clients. 

• Predictability. Full value delivery to beneficiary bank same day or next business day.

• Transparency and Finality. Clear transaction costs and payment schedules reduce payment uncertainty and assist with reconciliation.

• Security. Closed, permissioned network with Digital ID to reduce the opportunity for fraud Visa B2B Connect also offers transactions to non-participating banks.

• Enhanced Data. Direct messaging within the network facilitates efficient case resolution.

data.whatItDoes: Visa and 9Spokes have launched a business management dashboard proposition for Visa’s clients targeting the small and medium-size business segment. • Deliver richer, more engaging experiences to issuers' small business customers.

• Better understand their small business customers by harnessing the data collected via the platform (de-identified and aggregated).

• Limit digital developments, since the solution is already in market with clients.

• Reduce the need to onboard a new supplier, by providing easy access to a fintech deal.

data.description:
The Authorization Data APIs is a subscription-based web service that delivers authorization data - Approved, Declined or Rejected - for subscribed card accounts in near real time. Key Benefits of the Authorization Data APIs include:

• Pulls authorization data for any Visa card account that goes through VisaNet for authorization, such as PAN, Pseudo Account and Processor PANs.

• Accessed as a single API request for a single date or a date range.

• Supports both VCF and Non-VCF companies.

• Provides a single access point to authorization data for a specific account, list of accounts, or all accounts for an Issuer and/or Company.

• Integrated with the Visa Developer Platform—featuring Visa Developer APIs, secure development tools, Visa experts and resources from the world’s largest payment network.

Tools and technology to transform data into business-critical intelligence. Our Data and Reporting solutions offer:

• A fast and efficient way for issuers and their corporate clients to process business data.

• A simplified process of managing expenses, monitoring compliance, reconciling data, analyzing spend patterns and facilitating audits.

data.description:
Merchant Information Exchange Record (MIER) 2.0 provides Issuer and Processors with enriched merchant data revolving around key areas such as Merchant Street Address, Tax ID and Socio-economic data which are offered through two distinct files; Merchant Transaction Key File and Merchant Attribute File.

Merchant Information Exchange Record (MIER) 2.0 allows for:

data.whatItDoes: Visa Business Data Solutions provides clients and their corporate clients a suite of products and capabilities to simplify the critical processes that businesses perform daily. These critical processes include managing expenses, compliance, vendors and reporting, reconciling data and coding accounts to identify and audit transactions.
data.whatItDelivers: Addresses the challenge of delivering deliver rich, usable card data by offering a range of tools designed to make providing and accessing data easy and efficient as well as existing data sources (1300+) ranging from global TMCs, hotel chains, car rental agencies and marketplaces like Amazon Business. Visa Business Data Solutions offers services that are geared towards solving corporate business problems and toughest data challenges. Visa Business Data Solutions are connected to 4500+ end points including Global Expense Management system, ERP providers, etc.

data.whatItDoes: Issuers and their corporates obtain data through multiple sources to have a unified view of their data and integrate it into their systems to support the business process. data.whatItDelivers:
​Visa IntelliLink Data Solutions offers services that are geared towards solving corporate business problems and the toughest data challenges. This includes: 

• Inbound data mapping.

• Data customization and delivery.

• Reference data enrichment.

• Capturing and reconciling data that matters.

• Seamless integration with disparate data sources.

• Simple, intuitive solutions minimizing training need.

data.whatItDoes: ​Visa IntelliLink Enhanced Supplier Reporting (ESR) provides corporate clients the capability to generate merchant spend and demographic reports. It offers detailed and aggregated reports for merchants based on transactions and demographics such as veterans, minority and women-owned businesses.
data.whatItDelivers: ​Visa IntelliLink Enhanced Supplier Reporting (ESR) allows client transactions to be collected, aggregated, and paired with supplier information in an easy-to-use reporting tool on companies spend, Merchant information and demographics. ESR allows corporates to generate reports that can be used to verify and validate against their internal systems to ensure the transactions are reported for tax purposes. However, these reports are not legally binding and are used primarily for verification purposes.

data.whatItDoes: Visa SavingsEdge is a card-linked rewards program allowing business cardholders to earn discount savings when they shop at participating Merchants. Enrollment is free to cardholders, and participation is free to Issuers, because the rewards are funded by Merchants. This turnkey loyalty reward program is easy and fast for Issuers to launch and offer to Credit, Debit and Prepaid accounts, and it uses statement credits rather than coupons or codes to provide Merchant-funded discounts. Cardholders enroll one-time and gain access to the Visa SavingsEdge platform that identifies participating Merchant offers, Program Terms and Conditions (T&C) as well as frequently asked questions (FAQs). Issuers have the option of driving cardholders to a Visa SavingsEdge web site, or embedding the Visa SavingsEdge registration and program experience into their web or mobile environments using APIs. Purchases made using enrolled cards are tracked and qualified by Visa SavingsEdge, and a statement credit file is sent to the appropriate Issuers/processors who then pass the statement credits to the relevant card accounts. Through Visa SavingsEdge, issuers can drive increased purchase volume and loyalty with their most valued customers.
data.whatItDelivers:
• Designed to assist Issuers with acquisitions, retention, usage and growth.

• Allows cardholders to qualify for participating Merchant discounts by enrolling their eligible Visa cards on the Visa SavingsEdge website or through an Issuer-hosted Visa API.

• Provides a discount in the form of a credit, which appears on the cardholder statement.

• Provides Issuers with aggregated, non-personally identifiable information on cardholder behavior by publishing Visa SavingsEdge results.

Visa provides data-driven and easy-to-use solutions that:

• Enable spend monitoring and reporting

• Reduce fraud, misuse and abuse across employee card programs

data.whatItDoes: Visa IntelliLink Compliance Auditor (VICA) allows small and medium-sized organizations to monitor and track spend, misuse, abuse and fraudulent transactions by their employees on corporate, purchase and fleet card programs. Company auditors can record their findings in a simplified audit process, and complete their audit with appropriate disposition.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Visa IntelliLink Compliance Auditor provides the following: 

• The ability to create custom rules (policies) and reports. User can define rules and reports based on their company’s policy and leverage those provided by Visa that represent industry best practices.

• Machine learning capability to predict future fraud, misuse or abuse, using Visa’s proprietary scoring model and algorithms.

• Automated and manual transaction auditing capabilities.

• Graphical dashboard for transaction review and auditing in a single page with drill-down capabilities into individual transactions.

• Delivered as SaaS with no software to install, no seat licensing fees, unlimited users and 24/7 access.

data.whatItDoes: Visa IntelliLink Compliance Management (VICM) is a value-add product that allows companies to monitor spend as well as identify transactions that may require further investigation of employee’s card usage. VICM can be marketed to any enterprise-level company. This includes the federal government, state and local governments, as well as companies in the private sector.
data.whatItDelivers:
​Visa IntelliLink Compliance Management provides the following:

• The ability to view transactions based on company’s organizational hierarchy.

• The ability to create custom rules (policies) and reports. Users can define rules and reports based on their company’s policy and leverage those provided by Visa that represent industry best practices.

• Program management by department with case management and workflow capability to support large organizations.

• Machine learning to predict future fraud, misuse or abuse using Visa’s proprietary scoring model and algorithms.

• Automated and manual transaction auditing capabilities.

• Graphical dashboard for transaction review and auditing in a single page with drill down capabilities into individual transactions.

• Delivered as SaaS with no software to install, no seat licensing fees, unlimited users and 24/7 access.

data.whatItDoes: The Business Payment Solution Provider (BPSP) program is a buyer funded program that helps buyers access working capital by enabling card to non-card transactions.  A BPSP is often a bill payment fintech or accounts payable provider that registers with Visa as a Merchant, accepts B2B card transactions and then pays non-accepting suppliers via check or ACH.
data.whatItDelivers: Given the BPSP pays non-accepting suppliers, the program helps Issuers capture net new spend by providing buyers access to their working capital.

data.whatItDoes: Visa Supplier Enablement Services (SES) is a comprehensive service offering that assists Issuers/strategic partners with moving suppliers from current payment processes to Visa Commercial payments more efficiently and effectively. These services can be used to complement an organization’s internal resources and level of expertise—allowing for faster, smoother expansion of a commercial payment program.
data.whatItDelivers: Visa Supplier Enablement Services allows Visa corporate clients to grow their commercial card programs and achieve fast ramp to value. The goal is to enable the increase of payment volume and subsequent rebate volumes, by using the accounts payable (AP) information, without the use of the company’s AP or procurement resources.

data.description: The Supplier Enablement Supplier Analytics (SESA) Platform provides Visa Commercial Issuers and Fintech partners with enhanced analytics and recommendations on their Corporate client Accounts Payable data.  SESA is a self-service online tool providing results that show targeted spend, benchmarking, and supplier opportunity sizing.  The review of the buyer’s accounts payable supports sales and growth efforts by assessing spend and identifying suppliers to target for Visa Commercial payment.  SESA demonstrates the potential financial results by use of benchmarking against Visa's own commercial data, providing an understanding of estimated volume by quantifying and identifying potential suppliers.

A suite of solutions that improve the efficiency of making and receiving B2B payments. Visa’s Supplier Enablement and Acceptance solutions support collaborative commerce—an ecosystem where payments are streamlined for payers and payees alike. We provide integrated digital solutions and other tools that simplify often complex and costly B2B payments through automation. Visa's solutions:

• Close the gap between buyers and suppliers

• Reduce time-consuming and labor-intensive paper-based invoice processing and associated risks

• Drive efficiencies in the supply chain, realizing cost savings

• Facilitate payment methods optimal to both buyer and seller

data.description: Visa Business Pay (VBP) is a Visa-branded B2B invoicing platform where B2B suppliers can create, issue and manage their invoices, as well as initiate payment collection from the tool.  Buyers can use VBP to make Visa card payments on their invoices.

Visa Supplier Matching Service (SMS) is a fast and efficient way to identify suppliers that accept Visa Commercial payment products. SMS helps streamline procurement processes, reduce costs associated with payables, concentrate spend to increase derivative benefits and support Issuers as part of their commercial payment program life cycle steps. Supporting 26 countries today, SMS helps reduce time-consuming and labor-intensive paper-based invoice processing and check writing by the Issuers’ corporate clients. It allows Visa virtual card clients to grow their card programs and achieve fast ramp to value.

Businesses need to carefully manage and maximize cashflow and look for alternatives to their manual payment processes. Visa's Transaction Management solutions has a range of options that can help businesses of all sizes and levels of payment complexity meet these business, spend management and cashflow challenges head on.

data.whatItDoes: Visa Payables Automation (VPA) is an accounts payables solution enabling businesses to disperse payments via virtual credit cards for purchases of goods or services. Participating Issuers and their corporate clients use VPA through a simple user interface, payment file processing, or VPA APIs to distribute virtual card accounts as payment to suppliers for purchased goods or services. VPA not only eliminates paper checks and automates the payments process, but its configurable authorization controls add security and control around payments.
data.whatItDelivers: Virtual cards reduce the chances of fraud being carried out on a particular account. The payment details are typically either void after a single transaction, or have a transaction limit imposed on the card. In the same way as general tokenization, virtual cards will never expose the PAN and other payment details, even if compromised. Suppliers benefit from reduced check remittance handling, fewer returned checks and faster business payments. Commercial Issuers benefit from added fee revenue generated from card transaction interchange. Corporate clients receive additional working capital benefits since they are using a virtual card product. Visa Payables Automation can help the buyer improve their payment remittance processes, gain working capital efficiencies, reduce payment fraud and/or support their supply chain management strategies.

data.footNotes: *Virtual Card functionality will be available in Visa Spend Clarity for Business in September 2021
data.whatItDoes: Visa Spend Clarity for Business offers smaller businesses and their owners the automation and tools they need to keep spend on track, allowing them to focus on growing their business. Businesses get a clear view and and full control of employee expenses on the go with near real-time alerts and notifications of spend. They can track spending, categorize expenses and add receipts all via mobile app, also allowing them to set up and manage each employee with specific, personalized spending controls and transaction limits.
data.whatItDelivers:
Business owner. Company dashboards and automated reports of business spend allow better understanding of where and how business spend is occurring. 

Business owner/finance manager setting cardholder controls. Personalize card controls and limits, including location, channel, velocity, time, date and merchant category code.

Employee expenses on-the-go. Receipt and out of pocket expenses, digital capture and submission via mobile app. 

Business owner needs to replace time-consuming manual processes. Digitization of manual processes and automated reconciliation save time and reduce human error.

*Virtual Card functionality will be available in Visa Spend Clarity for Business in September 2021

data.whatItDoes:
Large organizations with sophisticated and matrixed approval structures require a powerful suite of solutions that can be used seamlessly across departments, entities and territories to ensure compliance, drive efficiencies and improve control in all areas of business spend. Visa Spend Clarity for Enterprise allows large corporates to identify spending patterns, highlight opportunities to save and enhance compliance.

Visa Spend Clarity for Enterprise enables larger organizations to understand and gain firm control of spend in every department. Organizations can maintain oversight of spending at all levels. Control individual spend and supplier payments with powerful solutions that support the transaction needs of larger organizations. Create and manage reports, with seamless integration into existing systems, get a clear view and control of employee expenses, customize dashboards for review of accounts.
data.whatItDelivers:
For employees with expenses on-the-go. Digital receipt and out-of-pocket expenses captured and submitted via mobile app. 

For program administrators with lots of corporate cards to manage. Ability to fine-tune and personalize card controls and limits, including location, channel, velocity, time, date and merchant category codes. 

For managers understanding spend with suppliers to negotiate terms. Increased efficiency with automated payments that adjust card limits to match approved supplier invoices. Customizable reports identify and compare spending trends with suppliers to better understand customer/supplier relationships and inform negotiations. 

For finance directors analyzing spend across businesses in the corporation. Customizable reports, enhanced transaction data and integration with ERP enable investigation and examination of spend across different corporate entities and territories. 

For finance managers seeking to protect working capital and optimize cashflow. Payables automation maximizes cashflow for businesses by using virtual cards. Virtual cards allow suppliers to take payment, with the purchasing business being charged on their card.
