data.whatItDoes:
Visa Direct is Visa’s global push payments platform that allows businesses, consumers and governments to deliver funds from an originating account to a recipient account via card rails (VisaNet) for domestic transactions and card or account (ACH/RTP) rails for cross-border transfers. Visa Direct is helping to digitize, speed up and simplify payments for over 30 use cases, including P2P, remittances and business disbursements to consumers, workers and small businesses.

Visa Direct use case opportunities have been categorized into four value propositions: Payouts to Workers, Payouts to Small Businesses, Global Money Movement and Digital Disbursements.

The use cases listed below are priority use cases for Visa Direct and do not include the comprehensive list of all use cases.

Payouts to Workers

• Gig Economy. Payouts to on-demand labor. 

• Payroll. Off-cycle payments like expense reimbursements to employees on payroll.

• Contractor. Payments from staffing companies to temporary workers and freelance professionals.

• MLM. Multi-level marketing payout commissions to professionals.

Payouts to Small Businesses

• Marketplaces. Payouts for goods sold or rented over an online marketplace platform.

• Merchant Settlement. Payout of retail sales from an acquirer to a small business.

• eCommerce Platforms. Payments to suppliers of eCommerce platforms following end customer transaction.

• SMB Lending. Digital transfers of loans to small businesses.

• eInvoicing/Accounting. Payments made to small businesses following service or goods transfer.

Global Money Movement (money transfer between individuals or accounts) 

• P2P. Transfer of funds between one individual to another domestically.

• P2P XB. Transfer of funds between one individual to another from one country to another.

• Wallets. Money transfer from a wallet or account to a wallet. 

• Brokerages. Payment transfer from a person’s brokerage account to their other account, like savings.

• NeoBanks/Online Savings. Transfer of funds between two financial accounts managed by same person.

• Cash Deposits. Cash transfer by way of depositing cash and digitally transferring to a financial account. 

Digital Disbursements (one-time digital payments to consumers and constituents)

• Government. Payments made from government to constituents like VAT refunds and relief aid.

• Healthcare. Reimbursements for out-of-pocket expenses or premium rebates.

• Gaming. Player winnings and other cash-outs across state lotteries, online casinos and sports betting.

• Insurance. Property and casual and other insurance claim payouts.

• Rewards/Reimbursements. Reimbursement of expenses or reward program benefits across industries.
data.whatItDelivers:
Reach. Visa Direct is a payment capability that makes it possible for businesses and people to move money to billions of cards and accounts worldwide. 

Visa Direct:

• Domestic and cross-border payments in 180+ countries.

• Facilitates domestic and cross-border payments, in over 160 currencies.

• Connects billions of endpoints across cards and accounts including 3+ billion Visa cards and 2 billion bank accounts.

Speed and convenience. Businesses can now use Visa Direct to offer fast, convenient payments—anytime.

• Visa Direct helps payment solutions meet today’s expectations of fast and seamless experiences from any connected device.

• Visa Direct helps enable simpler and more connected payment experiences for over 30 use cases including delivery for domestic and cross border, P2P and business disbursements to consumers, workers and small businesses. 

• Payments enabled by Visa Direct have the ability to be sent 24/7/365, including nights, weekends and holidays.• Real-time delivery to accounts linked to eligible debit cards.

Operational efficiency. A single access point helps businesses achieve global scale and cost optimization without the need to integrate with multiple domestic payment systems around the world.

• Visa Direct simplifies global payments for businesses by providing a single access point with the ability to deliver send billions of transactions directly to cards and accounts.

• Single connection for global scale via API suite.

• Option to send industry recognized formats that Visa can transform and process.

• Push and pull capabilities, reaching multiple end-points.

• Simplified reporting and rules-based exceptions handling.

• Enriched transaction quality through real-time processing and payment validation.

• Enriched liquidity through net settlement, multi-currency settlement and FX conversion.

Security. Visa’s network and proven risk solutions help ensure that funds and information are handled securely and appropriately.

• Visa has instituted a multi-layered system of controls to help mitigate fraud, compliance and regulatory risks. Visa is constantly evolving and innovating to stay abreast of the ever-changing payments landscape of tomorrow. Additionally, with industry best practices, product features and value-added services, banks can help companies mitigate risk associated with transaction acceptance.

• Visa operates a trusted ecosystem of approved partners. Each partner undergoes a rigorous assessment in order to send or receive payments via VisaNet. This relationship ensures that transactions flowing through our network are data rich, transparent and efficiently routed—providing clients visibility into transactions to help enable further decision making.

• Visa Direct is built on the same, secure Visa network that consistently processed over 183 billion transactions in fiscal year 2019, through more than 15,500 financial institutions in more than 200 countries and territories, in over 160 currencies and increasing. Visa’s vast card-based network has now expanded to provide transactions to bank accounts.

• Visa works in close cooperation with partners to offer Financial Institutions the ability to customize controls in line with their own regulatory obligations and risk appetites.

data.whatItDoes:
YellowPepper is a Visa owned subsidiary, acquired by Visa in December 2020 and founded with the goal of creating the next generation payments ecosystem through products that support real-time payments between card, account and blockchain networks, through a set of identity and payment APIs. 

The YellowPepper platform, called YEPEX, enables clients to easily launch card and account agnostic real-time solutions, while providing several value added services such as tokenization and identity validation. 

YellowPepper brings 5 core value propositions to its clients and partners: 

Brand and card agnostic. Offers a single point of connectivity that enables access to multiple rails such as Visa Direct, Mastercard Send, ACH, xBorder, and RTP, among others. Provides different rail options to execute money movements based on customer defined business rules. Supports any integration technology (API, Blockchain, ISO 8583, ISO20022).

Flexibility. Built on microservices, once connected to the platform, the financial institution may choose any or all of the offered solutions that best matches their necessities. 

Cloud based. Native cloud agnostic platform that ensures cost savings, top-notch security and the flexibility to adapt to any cloud provider (GCP, AWS, Azure, etc.) and to different deployment models, such as SaaS or On-Premises.

Fast time to market. Short time to revenue: 4-week deployment period (for standard implementation).

Security. PCI DSS 3.2 service provider level 1 certified.
data.whatItDelivers:
P2P payments. The YEPEX platform enables the transfer of funds securely in real time without worrying about compatibility between banks and networks. The YEPEX platform also verifies and manages all information using velocity limits, international AML lists and local blacklists, making sure only secure, authorized payments are delivered to end users. 

P2M payments. Using the YEPEX platform, Merchants can securely transfer and receive funds to and from customers who use different banks without the worry of compatibility between banks and networks. To ensure compatibility while maintaining simplicity, the YEPEX platform is built to handle many different types of payment and processing methods on the backend, while offering merchants and customers a single front end interface. 

Directory services. YellowPepper directory services support different types of aliases, such as mobile phone, email, government ID, nickname, etc. YellowPepper is also capable of managing financial institution payments programs and enables connectivity to other directories in a secure manner. 

Processing services. YellowPepper also offers processing alternatives and the flexibility to configure the most convenient rail to move the funds. This enables financial institutions to offer a single point of connectivity to multiple market rails and fast and safe real-time transfers between any cards.
